Lyrics: I've found a Friend; oh, such a Friend!<BON:nextLine/>He loved me ere I knew Him;<BON:nextLine/>He drew me with the cords of love,<BON:nextLine/>And thus He bound me to Him.<BON:nextLine/>And ‘round my heart still closely twine, <BON:nextLine/>Those ties which naught can sever,<BON:nextLine/>For I am His, and His is mine, <BON:nextLine/>Forever and forever. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>I've found a Friend; oh, such a Friend! <BON:nextLine/>He bled, He died to save me;<BON:nextLine/>And not alone the gift of life,<BON:nextLine/>But His own self He gave me. <BON:nextLine/>Naught that I have my own I call,<BON:nextLine/>I hold it for the Giver;<BON:nextLine/>My heart, my strength, my life, my all,<BON:nextLine/>Are His, and His forever. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>I've found a Friend; oh, such a Friend!<BON:nextLine/>All power to Him is given; <BON:nextLine/>To guard me on my upward course, <BON:nextLine/>And bring me safe to heaven.<BON:nextLine/>The eternal glories gleam afar,<BON:nextLine/>To nerve my faint endeavor;<BON:nextLine/>So now to watch, to work, to war, <BON:nextLine/>And then to rest forever. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>I've found a Friend; oh, such a Friend!<BON:nextLine/>So kind, and true, and tender;<BON:nextLine/>So wise a Counselor and Guide,<BON:nextLine/>So mighty a Defender.<BON:nextLine/>From Him, who loveth me so well,<BON:nextLine/>What power my soul can sever?<BON:nextLine/>Shall life or death, or earth or hell!<BON:nextLine/>No; I am His forever. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-139, AH-113, SDAH-186)
Title: I've Found A Friend

Lyrics: I heard the voice of Jesus say,<BON:nextLine/>"Come unto me and rest;<BON:nextLine/>Lay down; thou weary one lay down,<BON:nextLine/>Thy head upon my breast." <BON:nextLine/>I came to Jesus as I was,<BON:nextLine/>Weary, and worn, and sad;<BON:nextLine/>I found in him a resting place,<BON:nextLine/>And he has made me glad. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>I heard the voice of Jesus say,<BON:nextLine/>"Behold, I freely give;<BON:nextLine/>The living water; thirsty one,<BON:nextLine/>Stop down and drink and live."<BON:nextLine/>I came to Jesus, and I drank,<BON:nextLine/>Of that life-giving stream;<BON:nextLine/>My thirst was quenched, my soul revived,<BON:nextLine/>And now live in him. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>I heard the voice of Jesus say,<BON:nextLine/>"I am this dark world's light; <BON:nextLine/>Look unto me; thy morn shall rise,<BON:nextLine/>And all thy days be bright."<BON:nextLine/>I looked to Jesus, and I found, <BON:nextLine/>In him my star, my sun;<BON:nextLine/>And in that light of life I'll walk, <BON:nextLine/>Till all my journey's done. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-140, AH-//, SDAH-//)
Title: The Voice Of Jesus

Lyrics: I would be, dear Saviour, wholly Thine;<BON:nextLine/>Teach me how, teach me how; <BON:nextLine/>I would do thy will, O Lord, not mine, <BON:nextLine/>Help me, help me now. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>Wholly thine, ……. Wholly thine,<BON:nextLine/>(O Lord) (O Lord)<BON:nextLine/>Wholly thine this is my vow,<BON:nextLine/>Wholly thine, ……. Wholly thine,<BON:nextLine/>(O Lord) (O Lord) <BON:nextLine/>Wholly thine O Lord just now. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>What is worldly pleasure, wealth or fame,<BON:nextLine/>Without thee, without thee?<BON:nextLine/>I will leave them all for thy dear name,<BON:nextLine/>This my wealth shall be. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>As I cast earth's transient joys behind,<BON:nextLine/>Come thou near, come thou near;<BON:nextLine/>In thy presence all in all I find, <BON:nextLine/>‘Tis my comfort here. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-141, AH-236, SDAH-308)
Title: Wholly Thine

Lyrics: How sweet upon this sacred day,<BON:nextLine/>The best of all the seven;<BON:nextLine/>To cast our earthly thoughts away,<BON:nextLine/>And think of God and heaven! <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>How sweet the words of peace to hear,<BON:nextLine/>From him to whom ‘tis given;<BON:nextLine/>To wake the penitential tear,<BON:nextLine/>And lead the way to heaven! <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>And if to make our sins depart,<BON:nextLine/>In vain the will has striven;<BON:nextLine/>He who regards the inmost heart,<BON:nextLine/>Will send his grace from heaven. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-142, AH-96, SDAH-238)
Title: How Sweet

Lyrics: Lord, dismiss us with Thy blessing,<BON:nextLine/>Fill our hearts with joy and peace;<BON:nextLine/>Let us each Thy love possessing,<BON:nextLine/>Triumph in redeeming grace,<BON:nextLine/>O refresh us, O refresh us, <BON:nextLine/>Traveling through this wilderness! <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Thanks we give, and adoration,<BON:nextLine/>For Thy gospel's joyful sound;<BON:nextLine/>May the fruits of Thy salvation,<BON:nextLine/>In our hearts and lives abound, <BON:nextLine/>Ever faithful, ever faithful,<BON:nextLine/>To Thy truth may we be found. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>While our days on earth are lengthened,<BON:nextLine/>May we give them, Lord, to Thee;<BON:nextLine/>Cheered by hope, and daily strengthened,<BON:nextLine/>May we run, nor weary be,<BON:nextLine/>Till Thy glory, till Thy glory,<BON:nextLine/>Without clouds in heaven we see. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-143, AH-22, SDAH-64)
Title: Lord Dismiss Us

Lyrics: I'm pressing on the upward way, <BON:nextLine/>New heights I'm gaining ev'ry day;<BON:nextLine/>Still praying as I onward bound,<BON:nextLine/>"Lord, plant my feet on higher ground." <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>Lord, lift me up and let me stand,<BON:nextLine/>By faith, on heaven's table land,<BON:nextLine/>A higher place than I have found;<BON:nextLine/>Lord plant my feet on higher ground. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>My heart has no desire to stay, <BON:nextLine/>Where doubts arise and fears dismay;<BON:nextLine/>Though some may dwell where these abound, <BON:nextLine/>My prayer, my aim is higher ground. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>I want to live above the world, Tho'<BON:nextLine/>Satan's darts at me are hurled;<BON:nextLine/>For faith has caught the joyful sound,<BON:nextLine/>The song of saints on higher ground. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>I want scale the utmost height,<BON:nextLine/>And catch a gleam of glory bright;<BON:nextLine/>But still I'll pray till heav'n I've found,<BON:nextLine/>"Lord, lead me on to higher ground. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-144, AH-317, SDAH-625)
Title: Higher Ground

Lyrics: Ask not to be excused,<BON:nextLine/>There's earnest work to do; <BON:nextLine/>Stand ready to be used,<BON:nextLine/>Where God may station you. <BON:nextLine/>His invitation kind,<BON:nextLine/>To thee has oft been giv'n;<BON:nextLine/>Accept, and thou shalt find, <BON:nextLine/>‘Tis sweet to work for Heavev'n. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>Come, O come! (today) Ask not to be excused;<BON:nextLine/>Come, O come! (today) <BON:nextLine/>Stand ready to be used. <BON:nextLine/>Ask not to be excused,<BON:nextLine/>The answer may be giv'n; <BON:nextLine/>Thou hast my love abused,<BON:nextLine/>Thou art excused from heav'n <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Ask not to be excused,<BON:nextLine/>The Master calls today; <BON:nextLine/>Too long hast thou refused,<BON:nextLine/>Now hasten to obey.<BON:nextLine/>The harvest fields are white,<BON:nextLine/>The laborers are few;<BON:nextLine/>Let thy delight, <BON:nextLine/>The Master's work to do. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Ask not to be excused, <BON:nextLine/>There's danger in delay;<BON:nextLine/>That wondrous love abused,<BON:nextLine/>Forever turns away.<BON:nextLine/>While Mercy gently pleads, <BON:nextLine/>And points the way to heav'n,<BON:nextLine/>While Jesus intercedes, <BON:nextLine/>O come and be forgiv'n! <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-145, AH-//, SDAH-//)
Title: Ask Not To Be Excused

Lyrics: Live out Thy life within me,<BON:nextLine/>O Jesus, King of kings!<BON:nextLine/>Be Thou Thyself the answer,<BON:nextLine/>To all my questionings; <BON:nextLine/>Live out thy life within me,<BON:nextLine/>In all things have Thy way!<BON:nextLine/>I, the transparent medium,<BON:nextLine/>Thy glory to display. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>The temple has been yielded,<BON:nextLine/>And purified of sins;<BON:nextLine/>Let Thy Shekinah glory,<BON:nextLine/>Now shine forth from within,<BON:nextLine/>And all the earth keep silence,<BON:nextLine/>The body henceforth be,<BON:nextLine/>Thy silent, gentle servant,<BON:nextLine/>Moved only as by Thee. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Its members every moment,<BON:nextLine/>Held subject to thy call;<BON:nextLine/>Ready to have Thee use them,<BON:nextLine/>Or not be used at all,<BON:nextLine/>Held without restless longing,<BON:nextLine/>Or strain, or stress, or fret,<BON:nextLine/>Or chafings at Thy dealings,<BON:nextLine/>Or thoughts of vain regret. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>But restful, calm and pliant,<BON:nextLine/>From bend and bias free;<BON:nextLine/>Awaiting Thy decision, <BON:nextLine/>When thou hast need of me <BON:nextLine/>Live out Thy life within me, <BON:nextLine/>O Jesus, King of kings! <BON:nextLine/>Be Thou the glorious answer,<BON:nextLine/>To all my questionings. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-146, AH-247, SDAH-316)
Title: Thy Life Within Me

Lyrics: Closer to thee, my Father, draw me,<BON:nextLine/>I long for thine embrace;<BON:nextLine/>Closer within thine arms enfold me,<BON:nextLine/>I seek a resting place. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>Clos...…….er with the cords of love <BON:nextLine/>loser, closer, with the cords of love)<BON:nextLine/>Draw ...….. me to thyself above,<BON:nextLine/>(Draw me, draw me, to thyself above)<BON:nextLine/>Clos…………… er draw me, To thyself above.<BON:nextLine/>(Closer with the cords of love, "Draw me to thyself above,") <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Closer to thee, my Saviour, draw me,<BON:nextLine/>Nor let me leave thee more.<BON:nextLine/>Fain would I feel thine arms around me,<BON:nextLine/>And count my wand'rings o'er. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Closer by thy sweet Spirit draw me,<BON:nextLine/>Till I am all like thee;<BON:nextLine/>Quicken, refine, and wash and cleanse me, <BON:nextLine/>Till I am pure and free. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-147, AH-//, SDAH-//)
Title: Draw Me Closer To Thee

Lyrics: Anywhere with Jesus I can safely go, <BON:nextLine/>Anywhere he leads me in this world below;<BON:nextLine/>Anywhere without him, dearest joys would fade,<BON:nextLine/>Anywhere with Jesus I am not afraid. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>Anywhere! Anywhere! Fear I cannot know;<BON:nextLine/>Anywhere with Jesus I can safely go. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Anywhere with Jesus I am not alone, <BON:nextLine/>Other friends may fail me, he is still my own;<BON:nextLine/>Tho' his hand may lead me over dreary ways,<BON:nextLine/>Anywhere with Jesus is a house of praise. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Anywhere with Jesus I can go to sleep,<BON:nextLine/>When the gloomy shadows round about me creep<BON:nextLine/>Knowing I shall waken nevermore to roam, <BON:nextLine/>Anywhere with Jesus will be home sweet Home. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-148, AH-224, SDAH-508)
Title: Anywhere With Jesus

Lyrics: Walk in the light the Lord has given, <BON:nextLine/>To guide thy steps aright;<BON:nextLine/>His Holy Spirit, sent from heaven, <BON:nextLine/>Can cheer the darkest night. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>Walk in the light, ... Walk in the light. <BON:nextLine/>(Walk in the light, in the beautiful light of God, x2) <BON:nextLine/>Walk in the light,<BON:nextLine/>(Walk in the light, in the beautiful light of God) <BON:nextLine/>Walk in the light, the light of God. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Walk in the light of gospel truth, <BON:nextLine/>That shines from God's own Word;<BON:nextLine/>A light to guide in early youth, <BON:nextLine/>The faithful of the Lord. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Walk in the light; though shadows dark,<BON:nextLine/>Should fall across thy way;<BON:nextLine/>Darkness will flee before the light,<BON:nextLine/>Of God's eternal day. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Walk in the light, and thou shalt know,<BON:nextLine/>The love of God to thee;<BON:nextLine/>The fellowship, so sweet below,<BON:nextLine/>In heav'ns will sweeter be. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-149, AH-//, SDAH-//)
Title: Walk In The Light

Lyrics: O where are the reapers that garner in,<BON:nextLine/>The sheaves of the good from the fields of sin?<BON:nextLine/>With sickles of truth must the work be done,<BON:nextLine/>And no one may rest till the "harvest home" <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>Where are the reapers? O who will come,<BON:nextLine/>And share in the glory of the "harvest home."<BON:nextLine/>O, who will help us to garner in, <BON:nextLine/>The sheaves of good from the fields of sin? <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Go out in the highways and search them all,<BON:nextLine/>The wheat may be there, though the weeds are tall;<BON:nextLine/>Then search in the highway, and pass none by;<BON:nextLine/>But gather from all for the home on high, <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>The fields are all rip'ning, and far and wide;<BON:nextLine/>The world now is waiting the harvest tide;<BON:nextLine/>But reapers are few, and the work is great,<BON:nextLine/>And much will be lost should the harvest wait. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>So come with your sickles, yes sons of men,<BON:nextLine/>And gather together the golden grain;<BON:nextLine/>Toil on till the Lord of the harvest come,<BON:nextLine/>Then share ye his joy in the "harvest home." <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-150, AH-411, SDAH-//)
Title: Where Are The Reapers?

Lyrics: I am thinking today of that beautiful land,<BON:nextLine/>I shall reach when the sun goeth down;<BON:nextLine/>When thro' wonderful grace by my Saviour I stand,<BON:nextLine/>Will there be any stars in my crown? <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>Will there be any stars, any stars in my crown,<BON:nextLine/>When at evening the sun goeth down?<BON:nextLine/>When I wake with the blest, In the mansions of rest,<BON:nextLine/>Will there be any stars in my Crown? <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>In the strength of the Lord let me labor and pray,<BON:nextLine/>Let me watch as a winner of souls;<BON:nextLine/>That bright stars may be mine in the glorious day,<BON:nextLine/>When his praise like the sea-billows rolls. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>O what joy will it be when His face I behold,<BON:nextLine/>Living gems at His feet to lay down;<BON:nextLine/>It would sweeten my bliss in the city of gold, <BON:nextLine/>Should there be any stars in my crown. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-151, AH-360, SDAH-366)
Title: Will There Be Any Stars?

Lyrics: Speak to my soul dear Jesus,<BON:nextLine/>Speak now in tend'rest tone;<BON:nextLine/>Whisper in loving kindness,<BON:nextLine/>"Thou art not left alone."<BON:nextLine/>Open my heart to hear Thee, <BON:nextLine/>Quickly to hear Thy voice, <BON:nextLine/>Fill thou my soul with praises,<BON:nextLine/>Let me in Thee rejoice. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>Speak Thou in softest whispers,<BON:nextLine/>Whispers of love to me;<BON:nextLine/>"Thou shalt be always conq'ror,<BON:nextLine/>Thou shalt be always free."<BON:nextLine/>Speak Thou to me each day, Lord,<BON:nextLine/>Always in tend'rest tone,<BON:nextLine/>Let me now hear Thy whisper,<BON:nextLine/>"Thou art not left alone." <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Speak to Thy children ever,<BON:nextLine/>Lead in the holy way; <BON:nextLine/>Fill them with joy and gladness, <BON:nextLine/>Teach them to watch and pray, <BON:nextLine/>May they in consecration,<BON:nextLine/>Yield their whole lives to Thee,<BON:nextLine/>Hasten Thy coming kingdom,<BON:nextLine/>Till our dear Lord we see. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Speak now as in the old time,<BON:nextLine/>Thou didst reveal Thy will; <BON:nextLine/>Let me know all my duty,<BON:nextLine/>Let me Thy law fulfill,<BON:nextLine/>Lead me to glorify Thee,<BON:nextLine/>Help me to know Thy praise,<BON:nextLine/>Gladly to do Thy bidding,<BON:nextLine/>Honor Thee all my days. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-152, AH-355, SDAH-//)
Title: Speak To My Soul

Lyrics: Lord, for tomorrow and its needs, I do not pray;<BON:nextLine/>Keep me from ev'ry stain of sin, Just for today<BON:nextLine/>Let me no wrong or idle word, Unthinking say;<BON:nextLine/>Set Thou a seal upon my lips, Just for today. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>I would both diligently work, And duly pray;<BON:nextLine/>I would be kind in word and deed, Just for today;<BON:nextLine/>O make me strong to do Thy will, Swift to obey,<BON:nextLine/>Willing to sacrifice my self, Just for today. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>And if today this life of mine, Should ebb away;<BON:nextLine/>O may Thy promises divine, Still be my stay.<BON:nextLine/>So for tomorrow and its needs, I do not pray;<BON:nextLine/>O keep me, guide me, hold me Lord, Just for Today. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-153, AH-//, SDAH-//)
Title: Just For Today

Lyrics: Watchman, tell me, does the morning,<BON:nextLine/>Of fair Zion's glory dawn? <BON:nextLine/>Have the signs that mark His coming,<BON:nextLine/>Yet upon thy pathway shone? <BON:nextLine/>Pilgrim, yes! Arise, look round thee;<BON:nextLine/>Light is breaking in the skies;<BON:nextLine/>Gird thy bridal robes around thee,<BON:nextLine/>Morning dawns, Arise! Arise! <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Watchman, see, the light is beaming,<BON:nextLine/>Brighter still upon thy way; <BON:nextLine/>Signs through all the earth are gleaming,<BON:nextLine/>Omens of the coming day; <BON:nextLine/>When the Jubal trumpet, sounding, <BON:nextLine/>Shall awake from land and sea; <BON:nextLine/>All the saints of God, now sleeping,<BON:nextLine/>Clad in immortality. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Watchman, hail the light ascending,<BON:nextLine/>Of the grand Sabbatic year; <BON:nextLine/>All with voices loud proclaiming,<BON:nextLine/>That the kingdom now is near;<BON:nextLine/>Pilgrim, yes, I see just yonder,<BON:nextLine/>Canaan's glorious hights arise;<BON:nextLine/>Salem, too, appears in grandeur,<BON:nextLine/>Tow'ring ‘neath its sunlit skies. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Watchman, in the golden city,<BON:nextLine/>Seated on his jasper throne;<BON:nextLine/>Zion's King, arrayed in beauty,<BON:nextLine/>Reigns in peace from zone to zone; <BON:nextLine/>There on sunlit hills and mountains,<BON:nextLine/>Golden beams serenely glow; <BON:nextLine/>Purling streams and crystal fountains,<BON:nextLine/>On whose banks sweet flowers blow. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Watchman, see, the land is nearing,<BON:nextLine/>With its vernal fruits and flow'rs;<BON:nextLine/>On, just yonder, O how cheering! <BON:nextLine/>Bloom forever Eden's bow'rs,<BON:nextLine/>Hark! The choral strains are ringing,<BON:nextLine/>Wafted on the balmy air;<BON:nextLine/>See the millions, hear them singing,<BON:nextLine/>Soon the pilgrims will be there.<BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-154, AH-409, SDAH-//)
Title: Watchman, Tell Me

Lyrics: t may not be on the mountain's height,<BON:nextLine/>Nor over the stormy sea;<BON:nextLine/>It may not be at the battle's front,<BON:nextLine/>My Lord will have need of me;<BON:nextLine/>But if by a still, small voice he calls,<BON:nextLine/>To the paths that I do not know;<BON:nextLine/>I'll answer, dear Lord, with my hand in thine,<BON:nextLine/>I'll go where you want me to go. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt>:<BON:nextLine/>I'll go where you want me to go, dear Lord,<BON:nextLine/>Over mountains, or plain, or sea;<BON:nextLine/>I'll say what you want me to say, dear Lord,<BON:nextLine/>I'll be what you want me to be. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Perhaps today there are loving words,<BON:nextLine/>Which Jesus would have me speak;<BON:nextLine/>There may be now in the paths of sin,<BON:nextLine/>Some wand'rer whom I should seek;<BON:nextLine/>O Saviour, if thou wilt be my guide<BON:nextLine/>Tho' rugged and dark the way;<BON:nextLine/>My voice shall echo thy message sweet, <BON:nextLine/>I'll say what you want me to say. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>There's surely somewhere a lowly place,<BON:nextLine/>In earth's harvest fields so wide;<BON:nextLine/>Where I may labor thro' life's short day,<BON:nextLine/>For Jesus, the crucified;<BON:nextLine/>So trusting my all to thy tender care,<BON:nextLine/>And knowing thou lovest me;<BON:nextLine/>I'll do thy will with a heart sincere,<BON:nextLine/>I'll be what you want me to be. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-155, AH-352, SDAH-573)
Title: I'll Go Where You Want Me To Go

Lyrics: Angry words! Oh, let them never, <BON:nextLine/>From the tongue unbridled slip;<BON:nextLine/>May the heart's best impulse ever,<BON:nextLine/>Check them e'er they soil the slip. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>"Love one another," Thus saith the Saviour,<BON:nextLine/>(Love each other) (Love each other)<BON:nextLine/>Children, obey the Father's blest command;<BON:nextLine/>(‘Tis the Father's blest command)<BON:nextLine/>"Love one another," Thus saith the Saviour<BON:nextLine/>(Love each other) (Love each other) <BON:nextLine/>Children, obey his blest command<BON:nextLine/>("Tis his blest command) <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Love is much too pure and holy,<BON:nextLine/>Friendship is too sacred far;<BON:nextLine/>For a moment's reckless folly,<BON:nextLine/>Thus to desolate and mar. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Angry words are lightly spoken,<BON:nextLine/>Bitt'rest thoughts are rashly stired;<BON:nextLine/>Brightest links of life are broken,<BON:nextLine/>By a single angry word. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-156, AH-//, SDAH-//)
Title: Angry Words! Oh, Let Them Never

Lyrics: He that goeth forth with weeping,<BON:nextLine/>Bearing precious seed in love; <BON:nextLine/>Never tiring, never sleeping,<BON:nextLine/>Findeth mercy from above. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>Lo, the scene of verdure bright'ning!<BON:nextLine/>See the rising grain appear;<BON:nextLine/>Look! The waving fields are whit'ning,<BON:nextLine/>For the harvest time is near. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Soft descend the dews of heaven,<BON:nextLine/>Bright the rays celestial shine;<BON:nextLine/>Precious fruits will thus be given,<BON:nextLine/>Through and influence all divine. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Sow thy seed, be never weary,<BON:nextLine/>Let no fears thy soul annoy;<BON:nextLine/>Be the prospect ne'er so dreary, <BON:nextLine/>Thou shalt reap the fruits of day. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-157, AH-//, SDAH-//)
Title: Harvest Time

Lyrics: The world's glorious harvest is fast drawing on,<BON:nextLine/>The Master is calling his reapers to come;<BON:nextLine/>The grain bright and golden, in fields far and near,<BON:nextLine/>Is ripe for the garner when he shall appear. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>Hasten on glad day, Bear the sheaves. Away;<BON:nextLine/>(Hasten on, angel reapers, come, glad day,<BON:nextLine/>Bear the sheaves to the garner, far away;)<BON:nextLine/>Hasten on, glad day, Bear us .. home. <BON:nextLine/>(Hasten on, angel reapers, come, glad day, <BON:nextLine/>Bring the "harvest home." <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>That morn everlasting, that day free from tears,<BON:nextLine/>Is swiftly approaching as on roll the years;<BON:nextLine/>The wheat, rudely scattered by sin's cruel blast, <BON:nextLine/>Then hasten to gather e'er autumn be past. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>O sweet is the labor that floweth from love,<BON:nextLine/>A stream never failing, whose Fount is above;<BON:nextLine/>"Tis love that invites us, ‘tis love points the field,<BON:nextLine/>‘Tis love wields the sickle, and wondrous the yield. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-158, AH-//, SDAH-//)
Title: Hasten On, Glad Day

Lyrics: Blessed Lord, how much I need thee!<BON:nextLine/>Weak and sinful, poor and blind;<BON:nextLine/>Take my trembling hand and lead me,<BON:nextLine/>Strength and sight in thee I find. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>Ev'ry hour, ev'ry hour, Blessed Lord,<BON:nextLine/>How much I need thee! <BON:nextLine/>Ev'ry hour, ev'ry hour, <BON:nextLine/>Saviour, keep me ev'ry hour. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Clothe me with thy robe of meekness,<BON:nextLine/>Stained with sin this robe of mine;<BON:nextLine/>Teach first to feel my weakness,<BON:nextLine/>Then to plead for strength divine. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Safe am I if thou dost guide me,<BON:nextLine/>Trusting self how soon I fall;<BON:nextLine/>Walk life's rugged way beside me,<BON:nextLine/>Thou, my light, my life, my all. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Then what e'er the future bringeth,<BON:nextLine/>Smiles of joy or tears of grief;<BON:nextLine/>Still to thee my spirit clingeth,<BON:nextLine/>Thou art still my soul's relief. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-159, AH-221, SDAH-//)
Title: How Much I Need Thee

Lyrics: Oh, to be "Kept for Jesus!" <BON:nextLine/>Kept, by the power of God;<BON:nextLine/>Kept, from the world unspotted,<BON:nextLine/>Treading where Jesus trod. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>Oh, to be "Kept for Jesus!" <BON:nextLine/>Lord at Thy feet I fall;<BON:nextLine/>I would be "nothing, nothing, nothing;"<BON:nextLine/>Thou shalt be "all in all," <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Oh, to be "Kept for Jesus!"<BON:nextLine/>Serving as He shall choose;<BON:nextLine/>"Kept" for the Master's pleasure;<BON:nextLine/>"Kept" for the Master's use. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Oh, to be "Kept for Jesus!"<BON:nextLine/>Kept from the world apart; <BON:nextLine/>Lowly in mind and spirit,<BON:nextLine/>Gentle and pure in heart. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Oh, to be "Kept for Jesus!"<BON:nextLine/>Oh, to be all His own;<BON:nextLine/>Kept, to be His forever,<BON:nextLine/>Kept to be His alone! <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-160, AH-//, SDAH-//)
Title: Kept For Jesus

Lyrics: I have a Friend so precious,<BON:nextLine/>So very dear to me; <BON:nextLine/>He loves me with such tender love, <BON:nextLine/>He loves so faithfully;<BON:nextLine/>I could not live apart from Him,<BON:nextLine/>I love to feel Him nigh;<BON:nextLine/>And so we dwell together,<BON:nextLine/>My God and I. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>I tell Him all my sorrows,<BON:nextLine/>I tell Him all my joys; <BON:nextLine/>I tell Him all that pleases me,<BON:nextLine/>I tell Him what annoys;<BON:nextLine/>He tells me what I ought to do,<BON:nextLine/>He tells me how to try;<BON:nextLine/>And so we talk together,<BON:nextLine/>My Lord and I. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>He knows that I am longing,<BON:nextLine/>Some weary soul to win;<BON:nextLine/>And so He bids me go and speak,<BON:nextLine/>The loving word for Him;<BON:nextLine/>He bids me tell His wondrous love,<BON:nextLine/>And why He came to die;<BON:nextLine/>And so we work together,<BON:nextLine/>my Lord and I. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-161, AH-112, SDAH-456)
Title: My Lord And I

Lyrics: All the way my Saviour leads me;<BON:nextLine/>What have I to ask beside?<BON:nextLine/>Can I doubt His tender mercy,<BON:nextLine/>Who through life has been my guide?<BON:nextLine/>Heav'nly peace, divinest comfort,<BON:nextLine/>Here by faith in Him to dwell!<BON:nextLine/>For I know whate'er befall me,<BON:nextLine/>Jesus doeth all things well;<BON:nextLine/>For I know whate'er befall me,<BON:nextLine/>Jesus doeth all things well. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>All the way my Saviour leads me;<BON:nextLine/>Cheers each winding path I tread;<BON:nextLine/>Gives me grace for every trial,<BON:nextLine/>Feeds me with the living bread;<BON:nextLine/>Though my weary steps may falter,<BON:nextLine/>And my soul a-thirst may be,<BON:nextLine/>Gushing from the Rock before me,<BON:nextLine/>Lo! A spring of joy I see;<BON:nextLine/>Gushing from the Rock before me,<BON:nextLine/>Lo! A spring of joy I see. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>All the way my Saviour leads me;<BON:nextLine/>Oh, the fullness of His love!<BON:nextLine/>Perfect rest to me is promised,<BON:nextLine/>In my Father's house above;<BON:nextLine/>When I wake to life immortal,<BON:nextLine/>Wing my flight to realms of day,<BON:nextLine/>This my song through endless ages,<BON:nextLine/>Jesus led me all the way;<BON:nextLine/>This my song through endless ages,<BON:nextLine/>Jesus led me all the way. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-162, AH-296, SDAH-516)
Title: All The Way

Lyrics: Hark! The voice of Jesus calling,<BON:nextLine/>"Who will go and work today?<BON:nextLine/>Fields are white, the harvest waiting,<BON:nextLine/>Who will bear the sheaves away?"<BON:nextLine/>Loud and long the Master calleth,<BON:nextLine/>Rich reward he offers free;<BON:nextLine/>Who will answer, gladly saying,<BON:nextLine/>"Here am I, O Lord send me!" <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>If you can not cross the ocean,<BON:nextLine/>And the heathen lands explore,<BON:nextLine/>You can find the heathen nearer,<BON:nextLine/>You can help them at your door;<BON:nextLine/>If you can not speak like angels,<BON:nextLine/>If you can not preach like Paul,<BON:nextLine/>You can tell the love of Jesus,<BON:nextLine/>You can say He died for all. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>If you can not be a watchman,<BON:nextLine/>Standing high on Zion's wall,<BON:nextLine/>Pointing out the path to heaven,<BON:nextLine/>Of'ring life and peace to all,<BON:nextLine/>With your prayers and with your bounties,<BON:nextLine/>You can do what Heav'n demands,<BON:nextLine/>You can be like faithful Aaron,<BON:nextLine/>Holding up the prophet's hands. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>While the souls of men are dying,<BON:nextLine/>And the Master calls for you,<BON:nextLine/>Let none hear you idly saying,<BON:nextLine/>"There is nothing I can do!"<BON:nextLine/>Gladly take the task he gives you,<BON:nextLine/>Let his work your pleasure be;<BON:nextLine/>Answer quickly when He cal
Subtitle: (Vern-163, AH-341, SDAH-359)
Title: Here Am I, Send Me

Lyrics: Sitting at the feet of Jesus,<BON:nextLine/>O what words I hear him say!<BON:nextLine/>Happy place! So near, so precious! <BON:nextLine/>May it find me there each day;<BON:nextLine/>Sitting at the feet of Jesus,<BON:nextLine/>I would look upon the past,<BON:nextLine/>For his love has been so precious,<BON:nextLine/>It has won my heart at last <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Sitting at the feet of Jesus,<BON:nextLine/>Where can mortal be more blest?<BON:nextLine/>There I lay sins and sorrows,<BON:nextLine/>And, when weary, find sweet rest;<BON:nextLine/>Sitting at the feet of Jesus,<BON:nextLine/>There I love to weep and pray,<BON:nextLine/>While I from his fullness gather,<BON:nextLine/>Grace and comfort every day. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Bless me, O my Saviour, bless me,<BON:nextLine/>As I'm waiting at thy feet,<BON:nextLine/>O look down in love upon me,<BON:nextLine/>Let me see thy face so sweet;<BON:nextLine/>Give me, Lord, the mind of Jesus,<BON:nextLine/>Make me holy as he is,<BON:nextLine/>May I prove I've been with Jesus,<BON:nextLine/>Who is all my righteousness. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-164, AH-//, SDAH-//)
Title: At The Feet Of Jesus

Lyrics: I love thee, I love thee, I love thee my Lord;<BON:nextLine/>I love thee my Saviour, I love thee my God. <BON:nextLine/>I love thee, I love thee, and that thou dost know;<BON:nextLine/>But how much I love thee, my actions will show. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>I'm happy, I'm happy, O, wondrous account!<BON:nextLine/>My joys are immortal, I stand on the mount!<BON:nextLine/>I gaze on my treasure and long to be there,<BON:nextLine/>With Jesus and angels, and kindred so dear. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>O Jesus, my Saviour, with thee I am blest,<BON:nextLine/>My life and salvation my joy and my rest,<BON:nextLine/>Thy love be my story, thy name be my song;<BON:nextLine/>Thy grace shall inspire both my heart and my Tongue. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>O, who's like my Saviour? He's Salem's bright King;<BON:nextLine/>He smiles, and he loves me and helps me sing.<BON:nextLine/>I'll praise him with notes loud and clear,<BON:nextLine/>While rivers of pleasure my spirit do cheer. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-165, AH-357, SDAH-236)
Title: I Love Thee

Lyrics: Rock of ages cleft for me!<BON:nextLine/>Let me hide myself in thee;<BON:nextLine/>Let the water and the blood,<BON:nextLine/>From thy riven side that flowed,<BON:nextLine/>Be of sin the double cure, <BON:nextLine/>Save me from its guilt and power. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Not the labor of my hands,<BON:nextLine/>Can fulfill thy law's demands;<BON:nextLine/>Could my zeal no respite know, Could my tears forever flow,<BON:nextLine/>All for sin could not atone;<BON:nextLine/>Thou must save and thou alone. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Nothing in my hand I bring,<BON:nextLine/>Simply to thy cross I cling;<BON:nextLine/>Naked, come to thee for dress,<BON:nextLine/>Helpless, look to thee for grace;<BON:nextLine/>Foul, I to the Fountain fly,<BON:nextLine/>Wash me, Saviour, or I die. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>While I draw this fleeting breath,<BON:nextLine/>When mine eyes shall close in death;<BON:nextLine/>When I soar to worlds unknown,<BON:nextLine/>See thee on thy Judgment throne,<BON:nextLine/>Rock of ages cleft for me,<BON:nextLine/>Let me hide myself in thee. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-166, AH-237, SDAH-300)
Title: Rock Of Ages

Lyrics: How firm a foundation, ye saints of the Lord,<BON:nextLine/>Is laid for your faith in his excellent word;<BON:nextLine/>What more can he say than to you he hath said, <BON:nextLine/>Who unto the Saviour for refuge have fled,<BON:nextLine/>Who unto the Savior for refuge have fled? <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>"When thro' the deep waters I call thee to go,<BON:nextLine/>The rivers of sorrow shall not overflow;<BON:nextLine/>For I will be with thee, thy troubles to bless,<BON:nextLine/>And sanctify to thee thy deepest distress,<BON:nextLine/>And sanctify to thee thy deepest distress. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>"When thro' fiery trials thy pathway shall lie,<BON:nextLine/>My grace all-sufficient shall be thy supply;<BON:nextLine/>The flame shall not hurt thee; I only design,<BON:nextLine/>Thy dross to consume, and thy gold to refine,<BON:nextLine/>Thy dross to consume, and thy gold to refine. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>"The soul that on Jesus doth lean for repose,<BON:nextLine/>I will not, I will not, desert to his foes;<BON:nextLine/>That soul, tho' all hell should endeavor to shake,<BON:nextLine/>I'll never, no never, nor never forsake,<BON:nextLine/>I'll never, no never, no never forsake. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-167, AH-//, SDAH-//)
Title: Firm Foundation

Lyrics: The Lord is my shepherd, no want Shall I know;<BON:nextLine/>I feed in green pastures, safe-folded I rest;<BON:nextLine/>He leadeth my soul where the still waters flow,<BON:nextLine/>Restores me when wand'ring, redeems when oppressed. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Tho' the valley and shadow of death tho' I stray,<BON:nextLine/>Since thou art my guardian, no evil I fear;<BON:nextLine/>Thy rod shall defend me, Thy staff be my stay,<BON:nextLine/>No harm can befall with my Comforter near. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>In the midst of affliction my table is spread,<BON:nextLine/>With blessings unmeasured my cup runneth o'er;<BON:nextLine/>With perfume and oil thou annointest my head;<BON:nextLine/>O, what shall I ask of thy providence more. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Let goodness and mercy, my bountiful God,<BON:nextLine/>Still follow my steps till I meet thee above;<BON:nextLine/>I seek by the path which my fore fathers trod,<BON:nextLine/>Thru' the land of their sojourn, thy kingdom of love. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-168, AH-295, SDAH-546)
Title: The Lord Is My Shepherd

Lyrics: Heir of the Kingdom, O why dost thou slumber?<BON:nextLine/>Why art thou sleeping so near thy blest home? <BON:nextLine/>Wake thee, arouse thee, and gird on thine armor,<BON:nextLine/>Speed, for the moments are hurrying on. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Earth's mighty nations, in strife and commotions,<BON:nextLine/>Tremble with terror, and sink in dismay;<BON:nextLine/>Listen, ‘tis naught but the chariot's loud rumbling; <BON:nextLine/>Heir of the kingdom, no longer delay. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Stay not O stay not for earth's vain allurements,<BON:nextLine/>See how its glory is passing away;<BON:nextLine/>Break the strong fetters the foe hath bound o'er thee;<BON:nextLine/>Heir of the kingdom, turn, turn thee away <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Keep the eye single, the head upward lifted;<BON:nextLine/>Watch for the glory of earth's coming King; <BON:nextLine/>Lo! O'er the mountain-tops light is now breaking,<BON:nextLine/>Heir of the kingdom, rejoice ye and sing. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-169, AH-413, SDAH-594)
Title: Heir Of The Kingdom

Lyrics: My Maker and my King,<BON:nextLine/>To thee my all I owe;<BON:nextLine/>Thy sov'reign bounty is the spring,<BON:nextLine/>Whence all my blessing flow; <BON:nextLine/>Thy sov'reign bounty is the spring,<BON:nextLine/>Whence all my blessing flow. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>The creature of thy hand,<BON:nextLine/>On thee alone I live;<BON:nextLine/>My God, thy benefits demand,<BON:nextLine/>More praise than I can give;<BON:nextLine/>My God, thy benefits demand,<BON:nextLine/>More praise than I can give. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Lord, what can I impart,<BON:nextLine/>When all is thine before? <BON:nextLine/>Thy love demands a thankful heart,<BON:nextLine/>The gift alas! How poor,<BON:nextLine/>Thy love demands a thankful heart, <BON:nextLine/>The gift alas! How poor. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>O! Let thy grace inspire,<BON:nextLine/>My soul with strength divine;<BON:nextLine/>Let ev'ry word and each desire, <BON:nextLine/>And all my days be thine;<BON:nextLine/>Let ev'ry word and each desire,<BON:nextLine/>And all my days be thine. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-170, AH-54, SDAH-15)
Title: My Maker And My King

Lyrics: Watchman on the walls of Zion,<BON:nextLine/>What, O tell us of the night?<BON:nextLine/>Is the daystar now arising?<BON:nextLine/>Will the morn soon greet sight?<BON:nextLine/>O'er your vision,<BON:nextLine/>Shine there now some rays of light?<BON:nextLine/>O'er your vision,<BON:nextLine/>Shine there now some rays of light? <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Tell, O tell us, are the landmarks,<BON:nextLine/>On our voyage all passed by?<BON:nextLine/>Are we nearing now the haven?<BON:nextLine/>Can we e'en the land descry? <BON:nextLine/>Do we truly,<BON:nextLine/>See the heav'nly kingdom nigh? <BON:nextLine/>Do we truly, <BON:nextLine/>See the heav'nly kingdom nigh? <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Light is beaming, day is coming!<BON:nextLine/>Let us sound aloud the cry;<BON:nextLine/>We behold the daystar rising,<BON:nextLine/>Pure and bright in yonder sky!<BON:nextLine/>Saints be joyful;<BON:nextLine/>Your redemption draweth nigh;<BON:nextLine/>Saints be joyful<BON:nextLine/>Your redemption draweth nigh. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>We have found the chart and compass,<BON:nextLine/>And are sure the land is near; <BON:nextLine/>Onward, onward we are hasting,<BON:nextLine/>Soon the heaven will appear;<BON:nextLine/>Let your voices,<BON:nextLine/>Sound aloud your holy cheer; <BON:nextLine/>Let your voices, <BON:nextLine/>Sound aloud your holy cheer. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-171, AH-//, SDAH-//)
Title: What Of The Night?

Lyrics: How long, O Lord our Saviour, <BON:nextLine/>Wilt thou remain away?<BON:nextLine/>Our hearts are growing weary,<BON:nextLine/>Of thy so long delay.<BON:nextLine/>O when shall come the moment,<BON:nextLine/>When, brighter far than morn,<BON:nextLine/>The sunshine of thy glory, <BON:nextLine/>Shall on thy people dawn. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>How long, O gracious Master,<BON:nextLine/>Wilt thou thy household leave? <BON:nextLine/>So long hast thou now tarried,<BON:nextLine/>Few thy return believe,<BON:nextLine/>Immersed in sloth and folly,<BON:nextLine/>Thy servants, Lord, we see;<BON:nextLine/>And few of us stand ready,<BON:nextLine/>With joy to welcome thee. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>O, wake thy slumb'ring people;<BON:nextLine/>Send forth the solemn cry;<BON:nextLine/>Let all the saints repeat it,<BON:nextLine/>"The Saviour draweth nigh!"<BON:nextLine/>May all our lambs be burning,<BON:nextLine/>Our loins well girded be,<BON:nextLine/>Each longing heart preparing,<BON:nextLine/>With joy thy face to see <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-172, AH-//, SDAH-//)
Title: How Long?

Lyrics: How cheering is the Christian's hope, <BON:nextLine/>While toiling here below!<BON:nextLine/>It buoys us up while passing through,<BON:nextLine/>This wilderness of woe;<BON:nextLine/>It buoys us up while passing through,<BON:nextLine/>This wilderness of woe. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>It points to us a land of rest,<BON:nextLine/>Where saints with Christ will reign;<BON:nextLine/>Where we shall meet the loved of earth,<BON:nextLine/>And never part again,<BON:nextLine/>Where we shall meet the loved of earth, <BON:nextLine/>And never part again. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>A land where sin can never come,<BON:nextLine/>Temptations ne'er annoy;<BON:nextLine/>Where happiness will ever dwell,<BON:nextLine/>And that without alloy;<BON:nextLine/>Where happiness will ever dwell,<BON:nextLine/>And that without alloy. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>In that bright world no tears will flow,<BON:nextLine/>Death ne'er can enter there;<BON:nextLine/>For all who gain that heavenly land,<BON:nextLine/>will be as angels are;<BON:nextLine/>For all who gain the heavenly land,<BON:nextLine/>Will be as angels are. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Fly, ling'ring moments, fly, O fly,<BON:nextLine/>Dear Saviour, quickly come!<BON:nextLine/>We long to see thee as thou art,<BON:nextLine/>And reach that blissful home;<BON:nextLine/>We long to see thee as thou art,<BON:nextLine/>And reach that blissful home. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-173, AH-//, SDAH-533)
Title: How Cheering!

Lyrics: O for a faith that will not shrink,<BON:nextLine/>Tho' pressed by many a foe;<BON:nextLine/>That will not tremble on the brink,<BON:nextLine/>Of poverty or woe. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>That will not murmur or complain,<BON:nextLine/>Beneath the chast'ning rod;<BON:nextLine/>But in the hour of grief or pain,<BON:nextLine/>Can lean upon its God. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>A faith that shines more bright and clear,<BON:nextLine/>When rage without; <BON:nextLine/>Then when in danger knows no fear,<BON:nextLine/>In darkness feels no doubt. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>That bears unmoved the world's dread frown, <BON:nextLine/>Nor heeds its scornful smile;<BON:nextLine/>That sins wild ocean cannot drown,<BON:nextLine/>Nor its soft arts beguile. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Lord, give me such a faith as this,<BON:nextLine/>And then what'er may come;<BON:nextLine/>I'll taste e'en here the hallowed bliss,<BON:nextLine/>Of eternal home. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-174, AH-//, SDAH-440)
Title: O For A Faith

Lyrics: Saviour, like a shepherd lead us;<BON:nextLine/>Much we need thy tender care;<BON:nextLine/>In thy pleasant pastures feed us,<BON:nextLine/>For our use thy folds prepare;<BON:nextLine/>Blessed Jesus, blessed Jesus,<BON:nextLine/>Thou hast bought us, thine we are;<BON:nextLine/>Blessed Jesus, blessed Jesus,<BON:nextLine/>Thou hast bought us, thine we are. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>We are thine, do thou befriend us,<BON:nextLine/>Be the Guardian of our way; <BON:nextLine/>Keep thy flock, from sin defend us,<BON:nextLine/>Seek us when we go astray,<BON:nextLine/>Blessed Jesus, blessed Jesus, Hear, <BON:nextLine/>O hear us, when we pray;<BON:nextLine/>Blessed Jesus, blessed Jesus, Hear,<BON:nextLine/>O hear us , when we pray. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Thou hast promised to receive us,<BON:nextLine/>Poor and sinful though we be;<BON:nextLine/>Thou hast mercy to relieve us,<BON:nextLine/>Grace to cleanse, and power to free,<BON:nextLine/>Blessed Jesus, blessed Jesus,<BON:nextLine/>We will early turn to thee;<BON:nextLine/>Blessed Jesus, blessed Jesus, <BON:nextLine/>We will early turn to thee. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-175, AH-294, SDAH-545)
Title: Saviour, Like A Shepherd

Lyrics: There is a blessed hope,<BON:nextLine/>More precious and more bright;<BON:nextLine/>Than all the joy-less mockery,<BON:nextLine/>The world esteems delight. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>There is a lovely star,<BON:nextLine/>That lights the darkest gloom,<BON:nextLine/>And sheds a peaceful radiance o're,<BON:nextLine/>The prospects of the tomb. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>There is a cheering voice,<BON:nextLine/>That lifts the soul above;<BON:nextLine/>Dispels the painful, anxious doubt,<BON:nextLine/>And whispers, "God is love." <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>That voice from Calvary's height,<BON:nextLine/>Proclaims the soul forgiv'n;<BON:nextLine/>That star is revelation's light,<BON:nextLine/>That hope, the of heav'n. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-176, AH-//, SDAH-//)
Title: Blessed Hope

Lyrics: In the land of fade-less day,<BON:nextLine/>Lies "the city four-square."<BON:nextLine/>It shall never pass away,<BON:nextLine/>And there is "no night there." <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt> <BON:nextLine/>God shall "wipe away all tears;"<BON:nextLine/>(God shall "wipe away all tears)<BON:nextLine/>There's no death, no pain, no fears;<BON:nextLine/>(There's no death, no pain, no fears;) <BON:nextLine/>And they count not time by years,<BON:nextLine/>(And they count not time by years, by years)<BON:nextLine/>For there is "no night there." <BON:nextLine/>( For there is "no night there.") <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>All the gates of pearl are made,<BON:nextLine/>In "the city four-square,"<BON:nextLine/>All the streets with gold are laid,<BON:nextLine/>And there is "no night there." <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>And the gates shall never close,<BON:nextLine/>To "the city fore-square,"<BON:nextLine/>There life's crystal river flows,<BON:nextLine/>And there is "no night there." <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>There they need no sunshine bright,<BON:nextLine/>In "that city fore-square."<BON:nextLine/>For the Lamb is all the light, <BON:nextLine/>And there is "no night there." <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-177, AH-421, SDAH-427)
Title: No Night There

Lyrics: It may be at morn, when the day is awaking<BON:nextLine/>When sunlight thro' darkness and shadow is breaking<BON:nextLine/>That Jesus will come in the fullness of glory,<BON:nextLine/>To receive from the world His own. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt> <BON:nextLine/>O Lord Jesus, how long, how long,<BON:nextLine/>Ere we shout the glad song?<BON:nextLine/>Christ returneth, Hallelujah!<BON:nextLine/>Hallelujah! Amen, Hallelujah! Amen. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>It may be at midday, it may be at twilight,<BON:nextLine/>It may be, perchance, that the blackness of midnight,<BON:nextLine/>Will burst into light in the blaze of His glory,<BON:nextLine/>When Jesus receives His own. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>His hosts cry Hosanna, from heaven descending,<BON:nextLine/>With glorified saints and the angels attending.<BON:nextLine/>With grace on His brow, like a halo of glory,<BON:nextLine/>Will Jesus receive His own. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>O joy! O delight! Should we go without dying,<BON:nextLine/>No sickness, no sadness, no dread, and no crying,<BON:nextLine/>Caught up through the clouds with our Lord into glory, <BON:nextLine/>When Jesus receives His own. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-178, AH-402, SDAH-207)
Title: Christ Returneth

Lyrics: Are you ready for the Bridegroom,<BON:nextLine/>When he comes, when he comes? <BON:nextLine/>Are you ready for the Bridegroom,<BON:nextLine/>When he comes, when he comes?<BON:nextLine/>Behold, he cometh! Behold, he cometh!<BON:nextLine/>Be robed and ready; for the Bridegroom comes. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt> <BON:nextLine/>Behold the Bridegroom;<BON:nextLine/>for he comes, for he comes!<BON:nextLine/>Behold the Bridegroom;<BON:nextLine/>for he comes, for he comes.<BON:nextLine/>Behold he cometh! Behold he cometh!<BON:nextLine/>Be robed and ready<BON:nextLine/>for the Bridegroom comes. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Have your lamps trimm'd and burning,<BON:nextLine/>When he comes, when he comes;<BON:nextLine/>Have your lamps trimm'd and burning,<BON:nextLine/>When he comes, when he comes;<BON:nextLine/>He quickly cometh! He quickly cometh!<BON:nextLine/>O soul, be ready when the Bridegroom comes. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>We will all go out to meet him, <BON:nextLine/>When he comes, when he comes;<BON:nextLine/>We will all go out to meet him,<BON:nextLine/>When he comes, when he comes;<BON:nextLine/>He surely cometh! He surely cometh!<BON:nextLine/>We'll go out to meet him when the Bridegroom comes. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>We will chant alleluias,<BON:nextLine/>When he comes, when he comes;<BON:nextLine/>We will chant alleluias,<BON:nextLine/>When he comes, when he comes;<BON:nextLine/>Lo! Now he cometh! Lo! Now he cometh!<BON:nextLine/>Sing alleluia for the Bridegroom <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-179, AH-//, SDAH-//)
Title: Behold The Bridegroom

Lyrics: We know not the hour of the Master's appearing,<BON:nextLine/>Yet signs all foretell that the moment is nearing;<BON:nextLine/>When he shall return, ‘tis a promise most cheering,<BON:nextLine/>But we know not the hour. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>He will come. (He will come)<BON:nextLine/>Let us watch and be ready;<BON:nextLine/>He will come… (He will come) <BON:nextLine/>Hallelujah! Hallelujah!<BON:nextLine/>He will come in the clouds, of his Father's bright glory; <BON:nextLine/>But we know not the hour. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>There's light for the wise who are seeking salvation,<BON:nextLine/>There's truth in the Book of Divine revelation<BON:nextLine/>Each prophecy points to the great consummation,<BON:nextLine/>But we know not the hour. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>We'll watch and we'll pray,<BON:nextLine/>with our lamps trimmed and burning,<BON:nextLine/>We'll work and we'll wait <BON:nextLine/>till the Master's returning,<BON:nextLine/>We'll sing and rejoice,<BON:nextLine/>ev,ry omen discerning, <BON:nextLine/>But we know not the hour. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-180, AH-400, SDAH-604)
Title: We Know Not The Hour

Lyrics: We know not the time when He cometh,<BON:nextLine/>At even, or midnight, or morn;<BON:nextLine/>It may be at deepening twilight,<BON:nextLine/>It may be at earliest dawn,<BON:nextLine/>He bids to watch and be ready, <BON:nextLine/>Nor suffer our lights to grow dim,<BON:nextLine/>That when He shall come, He may find us,<BON:nextLine/>All waiting and watching for Him. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>Waiting and watching, <BON:nextLine/>(Waiting and watching, yes, waiting for thee)<BON:nextLine/>Waiting and watching, <BON:nextLine/>(Waiting and watching, yes, waiting for thee) <BON:nextLine/>Waiting and watching, <BON:nextLine/>(Waiting and watching, yes, waiting for Thee)<BON:nextLine/>Still waiting and watching for Thee. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>I think of His wonderful pity,<BON:nextLine/>The price our salvation hath cost; <BON:nextLine/>He left the bright mansions of glory,<BON:nextLine/>To suffer and die for the lost,<BON:nextLine/>And sometimes I think it will please Him,<BON:nextLine/>When those whom He died to redeem,<BON:nextLine/>Rejoice in the hope of His coming,<BON:nextLine/>By waiting and watching for Him. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>O Jesus, my loving Redeemer,<BON:nextLine/>Thou knowest I cherish as dear;<BON:nextLine/>The hope that mine eyes shall behold Thee, <BON:nextLine/>That I shall thine own welcome hear!<BON:nextLine/>If to some as Judge thou appearest,<BON:nextLine/>Who forth from Thy presence would flee,<BON:nextLine/>A Friend most beloved I'll greet Thee, <BON:nextLine/>I'm waiting and watching for Thee. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-181, AH-398, SDAH-//)
Title: Waiting And Watching

Lyrics: The golden morning is fast approaching;<BON:nextLine/>Jesus soon will come,<BON:nextLine/>To take his faithful and happy children,<BON:nextLine/>To their promised home. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>O we see the gleams of the golden morning,<BON:nextLine/>Piercing through this night of gloom!<BON:nextLine/>O we see the gleams of the golden morning,<BON:nextLine/>That will burst the tomb. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>The gospel summons will soon be carried,<BON:nextLine/>To the nations round;<BON:nextLine/>The Bridegroom then will cease to tarry, <BON:nextLine/>And the trumpet sound. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Attended by all the shining angels,<BON:nextLine/>Down the flaming sky,<BON:nextLine/>The Judge will come, and will take his people,<BON:nextLine/>Where they will not die. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>The loved of earth who have long been parted,<BON:nextLine/>Meet in that glad day;<BON:nextLine/>The tears of those who are broken hearted, <BON:nextLine/>Shall be wiped away. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-182, AH-394, SDAH-205)
Title: Gleams Of The Golden Morning

Lyrics: Sweet promise is giv'vn to all who believe, "Behold I come quickly, mine own to receive; Hold fast till I come; the danger is great; Sleep not as do others; be watchful, and wait." <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt> "Hold fast till I come," sweet promise of heav'n, "The kingdom restored, to you shall be giv'n," "Come, enter my joy, sit down on my throne; Bright crowns are in waiting; Hold fast till I come <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>We'll "watch unto pray'r" with lamps burning bright; He comes to all others a thief in the night. We know he is near, but know not the day, As spring shows that summer is not far away. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Yes! This is our hope, ‘tis built on His word, The glorious appearing of Jesus, our Lord; Of promises all, it stands as the sum; "Behold I come quickly, hold fast till come." <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-183, AH-333, SDAH-600)
Title: Hold Fast Till I Come

Lyrics: Joy to the world, the Lord will come!<BON:nextLine/>Let earth receive her King;<BON:nextLine/>Let every heart prepare him room,<BON:nextLine/>And heav'n and nature sing,<BON:nextLine/>And heav'n and nature sing,<BON:nextLine/>And heav'n, and heav'n and nature sing. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Joy to the earth, the Lord will reign!<BON:nextLine/>Let men their sings employ;<BON:nextLine/>While fields and floods, rocks hills, and plains,<BON:nextLine/>Repeat the sounding joy,<BON:nextLine/>Repeat the sounding joy,<BON:nextLine/>Repeat, repeat the sounding joy. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Soon will he rule the earth with grace,<BON:nextLine/>And make the nations prove;<BON:nextLine/>The glories of his righteousness,<BON:nextLine/>And wonders of his love,<BON:nextLine/>And wonders of his love, <BON:nextLine/>And won- and wonders of his love. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-184, AH-403, SDAH-125)
Title: Joy To The World

Lyrics: We speak of the realms of the blest,<BON:nextLine/>That country so bright and so fair,<BON:nextLine/>And oft are its glories confessed,<BON:nextLine/>But what must it be to be there! <BON:nextLine/>We speak of it streets of pure gold,<BON:nextLine/>Its walls decked with jewels so rare,<BON:nextLine/>Its wonders and pleasures untold,<BON:nextLine/>But what must it be to be there. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>We speak of its freedom from sin,<BON:nextLine/>From sorrow, temptation and care,<BON:nextLine/>From trials without and within,<BON:nextLine/>But what must it be to be there!<BON:nextLine/>We speak of its service of love,<BON:nextLine/>And robes which the glorified wear,<BON:nextLine/>The church of the firstborn above,<BON:nextLine/>But what must it be to be there! <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Do Thou, midst temptation and woe,<BON:nextLine/>For heaven my spirit prepare,<BON:nextLine/>And shortly I also shall know,<BON:nextLine/>And feel what it is to be there;<BON:nextLine/>Then o'er the bright fields we shall roam,<BON:nextLine/>In glory celestial and fair, <BON:nextLine/>With saints and with angels at home,<BON:nextLine/>And Jesus himself will be there. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-185, AH-411, SDAH-434)
Title: To Be There

Lyrics: Lord we have met again;<BON:nextLine/>In this thine house of prayer.<BON:nextLine/>Come Holy Spirit, later rain;<BON:nextLine/>And fill us with thy power. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Our hearts to Thee we give;<BON:nextLine/>That we may be like Thee.<BON:nextLine/>Our souls, our minds dear Lord revive;<BON:nextLine/>Our spirits yearn for Thee. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>And when Thy word is read;<BON:nextLine/>Thy call to us is made.<BON:nextLine/>May we in gratitude respond;<BON:nextLine/>To Thy sweet voice above. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Prepare for us a place;<BON:nextLine/>In Thy dear heav'n above.<BON:nextLine/>Where all is peace, and joy, and love; <BON:nextLine/>That we may rest in peace. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-186, AH-//, SDAH-//)
Title: Lord We Have Met

Lyrics: Saviour, again to thy dear name we raise,<BON:nextLine/>With one accord our parting hymn of praise;<BON:nextLine/>We stand to bless thee ere our worship cease,<BON:nextLine/>Thee, lowly kneeling, wait thy word of peace. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Grant us thy peace upon our homeward way;<BON:nextLine/>With thee began, with thee shall end the day;<BON:nextLine/>Guard thou the lips from sin, the heart from shame,<BON:nextLine/>That in this house have called upon thy name. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Grant us thy peace thro'-out our early life,<BON:nextLine/>Our balm in sorrow, and our stay in strife,<BON:nextLine/>Then when thy voice shall bid our conflict cease,<BON:nextLine/>Call us, O Lord, to thine eternal peace. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-187, AH-//, SDAH-//)
Title: Our Parting Hymn

Lyrics: Chief of sinners though I be,<BON:nextLine/>Jesus shed His blood for me;<BON:nextLine/>Died that I might live on high,<BON:nextLine/>Died that I might never die;<BON:nextLine/>As the branch is to the vine,<BON:nextLine/>I am His and He is mine. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>O the height of Jesus' love!<BON:nextLine/>Higher than the heaven above;<BON:nextLine/>Deeper than the deepest sea,<BON:nextLine/>Lasting as eternity;<BON:nextLine/>Love that found me wondrous thought!<BON:nextLine/>Found me when I sought him not. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Chief of sinners though I be,<BON:nextLine/>Christ is all in all to me;<BON:nextLine/>All my wants to Him are known,<BON:nextLine/>All my sorrows are His own; <BON:nextLine/>Safe with Him from earthly strife,<BON:nextLine/>He sustains the hidden life. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-188, AH-188, SDAH-295)
Title: Chief Of Sinners

Lyrics: We've no abiding city here;<BON:nextLine/>Sad truth, were this to be our home;<BON:nextLine/>But let this thought our spirits cheer,<BON:nextLine/>We seek a city yet to come,<BON:nextLine/>We seek a city yet to come. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>We've no abiding city here;<BON:nextLine/>We seek a city out of sight;<BON:nextLine/>Zion its name the Lord is there, <BON:nextLine/>It shines with everlasting light,<BON:nextLine/>It shines with everlasting light. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>O sweet abode of peace and love,<BON:nextLine/>Where pilgrims, freed from toil, are blest!<BON:nextLine/>Had I the pinions of a dove,<BON:nextLine/>I'd fly to thee, and be at rest,<BON:nextLine/>I'd fly to thee, and be at rest. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>But hush, my soul! Nor dare repine;<BON:nextLine/>The time my God appoints is best;<BON:nextLine/>While here, to do His will be mine,<BON:nextLine/>And His to fix my time of rest,<BON:nextLine/>And His to fix my time of rest. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-189, AH-417, SDAH-//)
Title: No Abiding City

Lyrics: Take the name of Jesus with you,<BON:nextLine/>Child of sorrow and of woe;<BON:nextLine/>It will joy and comfort give you,<BON:nextLine/>Take it, then, where'er you go. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt> <BON:nextLine/>Precious name, .. .. O how sweet!<BON:nextLine/>(Precious name) (O how sweet) <BON:nextLine/>Hope of earth and joy of heav'n;<BON:nextLine/>Precious name, O how sweet! <BON:nextLine/>(Precious name) (O how sweet) <BON:nextLine/>Hope of earth and joy of heav'n. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Take the name of Jesus ever,<BON:nextLine/>As a shield from every snare;<BON:nextLine/>If temptations ‘round you gather,<BON:nextLine/>Breathe that holy name in prayer. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>O the precious name of Jesus!<BON:nextLine/>How it thrills our souls with joy,<BON:nextLine/>When his loving arms receive us,<BON:nextLine/>And his songs our tongues employ! <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>At the name of Jesus bowing,<BON:nextLine/>Falling prostrate at his feet,<BON:nextLine/>King of kings in heav'n we'll crown him,<BON:nextLine/>When our journey is complete. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-190, AH-//, SDAH-//)
Title: Precious Name

Lyrics: Blessed assurance, Jesus is mine!<BON:nextLine/>O, what a fore-taste of glory divine!<BON:nextLine/>Heir of salvation purchase of God,<BON:nextLine/>Born of his spirit, washed in his blood. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>This is my story, this is my song,<BON:nextLine/>Praising my Saviour all the day long;<BON:nextLine/>This is my story, this is my song,<BON:nextLine/>Praising my Saviour all the day long. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Perfect submission, perfect delight,<BON:nextLine/>Visions of rapture now burst on my sight,<BON:nextLine/>Angels descending bring from above,<BON:nextLine/>Echoes of mercy, whispers of love. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Perfect submission, all is at rest,<BON:nextLine/>I in my Saviour am happy and blest,<BON:nextLine/>Watching and waiting, looking above,<BON:nextLine/>Filled with his goodness, lost in his love. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-191, AH-260, SDAH-462)
Title: Blessed Assurance

Lyrics: Down at the cross where my Saviour died, Down where for cleansing from sin I cried, There to my heart was the blood applied, Glory to his name. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>Glory to his name, Glory to his name;<BON:nextLine/>There to my heart was the blood applied,<BON:nextLine/>Glory to his name. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>I am so wondrously saved from sin,<BON:nextLine/>Jesus so sweetly abides within, <BON:nextLine/>There at the cross where he took me in,<BON:nextLine/>Glory to his name. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>O precious fountain that saves from sin!<BON:nextLine/>I am so glad I have entered in,<BON:nextLine/>There Jesus saves me and keeps me clean,<BON:nextLine/>Glory to his name. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Come to this Fountain so rich and sweet,<BON:nextLine/>Cast thy poor soul at the Saviour's feet,<BON:nextLine/>Plunge in today and be made complete,<BON:nextLine/>Glory to his name. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-192, AH-//, SDAH-//)
Title: Glory To His Name

Lyrics: Would you live for Jesus,<BON:nextLine/>and be always pure and good?<BON:nextLine/>Would you walk with Him <BON:nextLine/>within the narrow road? <BON:nextLine/>Would you have Him bear <BON:nextLine/>your burden, carry all your load?<BON:nextLine/>Let Him have His way with thee. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>His pow'r can make you what ought to be;<BON:nextLine/>His blood can cleanse your heart, and make you free; <BON:nextLine/>His love can fill your soul, and you will see,<BON:nextLine/>‘Twas best for Him to have His way with thee. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Would you have Him make you free, and follow at His call?<BON:nextLine/>Would you know the peace that comes by giving all?<BON:nextLine/>Would you have Him save you, so that you need never fall?<BON:nextLine/>Let Him have His way with thee. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Would you in His kingdom find a place of perfect rest?<BON:nextLine/>Would you prove Him true in providential rest?<BON:nextLine/>Would you in service labor always at your best?<BON:nextLine/>Let Him have His way with thee. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-193, AH-//, SDAH-//)
Title: His Way With Thee

Lyrics: There is beauty all around,<BON:nextLine/>When there's love at home;<BON:nextLine/>There is joy in every sound,<BON:nextLine/>When There's love at home.<BON:nextLine/>Peace and plenty here abide,<BON:nextLine/>Smiling fair on every side;<BON:nextLine/>Time doth softly, sweetly glide,<BON:nextLine/>When there's love at home. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>Love at home, love at home;<BON:nextLine/>Time doth softly, sweetly glide,<BON:nextLine/>When there's love at home. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>In the cottage there is joy,<BON:nextLine/>When there's love at home;<BON:nextLine/>Hate and envy ne'er annoy,<BON:nextLine/>When there's love at home. <BON:nextLine/>Roses blossom ‘neath our feet,<BON:nextLine/>All the earth's a garden sweet,<BON:nextLine/>Making life a bliss complete,<BON:nextLine/>When there's love at home. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Kindly heaven smiles above,<BON:nextLine/>When there's love at home;<BON:nextLine/>All the earth is filled with love,<BON:nextLine/>When there's love at home.<BON:nextLine/>Sweeter sings the brooklet by,<BON:nextLine/>Brighter beams the azure sky;<BON:nextLine/>O, there's One who smiles on high,<BON:nextLine/>When there's love at home. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Jesus, make me wholly thine,<BON:nextLine/>Then there's love at home;<BON:nextLine/>May thy sacrifice be mine,<BON:nextLine/>Then there's love at home.<BON:nextLine/>Safely from all harm I'll rest,<BON:nextLine/>With no sinful care distressed;<BON:nextLine/>Through thy tender mercy ble
Subtitle: (Vern-194, AH-//, SDAH-652)
Title: Love At Home

Lyrics: O for that flame of living fire,<BON:nextLine/>Which shone so bright in saints of old;<BON:nextLine/>Which bade their souls to heaven aspire,<BON:nextLine/>Calm in distress, in danger bold! <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Where is that spirit, Lord, which dwelt,<BON:nextLine/>In Abram's breast, and sealed him Thine?<BON:nextLine/>Which made Paul's heart with sorrow melt,<BON:nextLine/>And glow with energy divine? <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>That spirit which from age to age,<BON:nextLine/>Proclaimed Thy love, and taught Thy ways? <BON:nextLine/>Brightened Isaiah's vivid page,<BON:nextLine/>And breathed in David's hallowed lays? <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Is not Thy grace as mighty now,<BON:nextLine/>As when Elijah felt its power? <BON:nextLine/>When glory beamed from Moses' brow,<BON:nextLine/>Or Job endured the trying hour? <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Remember, Lord, the ancient days;<BON:nextLine/>Renew Thy work, Thy grace restore;<BON:nextLine/>And while to Thee our hearts we raise,<BON:nextLine/>On us Thy holy Spirit pour. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-195, AH-149, SDAH-264)
Title: O For That Flame

Lyrics: Would you be free from the burden of sin?<BON:nextLine/>There's power in the blood, power in the blood;<BON:nextLine/>Would you o'er evil a victory win?<BON:nextLine/>There's wonderful power in the blood. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>There is power, power, wonderworking power<BON:nextLine/>in the blood of the Lamb;<BON:nextLine/>There is power, power, wonderworking power,<BON:nextLine/>In the precious blood of the Lamb. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Would you be free from your passion and pride?<BON:nextLine/>There's power in the blood, power in the blood;<BON:nextLine/>Come for a cleansing to Calvary's tide,<BON:nextLine/>There's wonderful power in the blood. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Would you be whiter, much whiter than snow? <BON:nextLine/>There's power in the blood, power in the blood;<BON:nextLine/>Sin stains are lost in its life-giving flow,<BON:nextLine/>There's wonderful power in the blood. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Would you do service for Jesus your King? <BON:nextLine/>There's power in the blood, power in the blood;<BON:nextLine/>Would you live daily His praises to sing?<BON:nextLine/>There's wonderful power in the blood. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-196, AH-//, SDAH-294)
Title: Power In The Blood

Lyrics: There'll be no dark valley when Jesus comes,<BON:nextLine/>There'll be no dark valley when Jesus comes;<BON:nextLine/>There'll be no dark valley when Jesus comes,<BON:nextLine/>To gather His loved ones home. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>To gather His loved ones home,<BON:nextLine/>To gather His loved ones home;<BON:nextLine/>There'll be no dark valley when Jesus comes,<BON:nextLine/>To gather His loved ones home. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>There'll be no more sorrow when Jesus comes,<BON:nextLine/>There'll be no more sorrow when Jesus come;<BON:nextLine/>There'll be no more sorrow when Jesus comes,<BON:nextLine/>To gather His loved ones home. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>There'll be no more weeping when Jesus comes,<BON:nextLine/>There'll be no more weeping when Jesus comes;<BON:nextLine/>There'll be no more weeping when Jesus comes,<BON:nextLine/>To gather His loved ones home. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>There'll be songs of greeting when Jesus comes,<BON:nextLine/>There'll be songs of greeting when Jesus comes;<BON:nextLine/>There'll be songs of greeting when Jesus comes,<BON:nextLine/>To gather His loved ones home. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-197, AH-//, SDAH-208)
Title: There'll Be No Dark Valley

Lyrics: Oh, the best friend to have is Jesus,<BON:nextLine/>When the cares of life upon you roll,<BON:nextLine/>He will heal the wounded heart,<BON:nextLine/>He will strength and grace impart;<BON:nextLine/>Oh, the best friend to have is Jesus. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>The best friend to have is Jesus,<BON:nextLine/>(Jesus every day)<BON:nextLine/>The best friend to have is Jesus <BON:nextLine/>(Jesus all the way) <BON:nextLine/>He will help you when you fall,<BON:nextLine/>He will hear you when you call;<BON:nextLine/>Oh, the best friend to have is Jesus. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>What a friend I have found in Jesus!<BON:nextLine/>Peace and comfort to my soul He brings; <BON:nextLine/>Leaning on His mighty arm, I will fear no ill nor harm;<BON:nextLine/>Oh, the best friend to have is Jesus. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Though I pass through the night of sorrow,<BON:nextLine/>And the chilly waves of Jordan roll,<BON:nextLine/>Never need I shrink nor fear, For my Saviour is so near;<BON:nextLine/>Oh the best friend to have is Jesus. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>When at last to our home we gather,<BON:nextLine/>With the faithful who have gone before, <BON:nextLine/>We will sing upon the shore, Praising Him forevermore;<BON:nextLine/>Oh, the best friend to have is Jesus. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-198, AH-//, SDAH-//)
Title: The Best Friend Is Jesus

Lyrics: To God be the glory, great things He hath done,<BON:nextLine/>So loved He the world that He gave us His Son;<BON:nextLine/>Who yielded His life an atonement for sin, <BON:nextLine/>And opened the Life-gate that all may go in. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt> <BON:nextLine/>Praise the Lord, praise the Lord,<BON:nextLine/>Let the earth hear His voice;<BON:nextLine/>Praise the Lord, praise the Lord, Let the people rejoice,<BON:nextLine/>O come to the Father, through Jesus the Son,<BON:nextLine/>And give Him The glory, great things He hath done. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>O perfect redemption the purchase of blood,<BON:nextLine/>To every believer the promise of God;<BON:nextLine/>The vilest offender who truly believes,<BON:nextLine/>That moment from Jesus a pardon receives. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Great things He hath taught us great things He hath done,<BON:nextLine/>And great our rejoicing thro' Jesus the Son; <BON:nextLine/>But purer, and higher, and greater will be,<BON:nextLine/>Our wonder, our transport, when Jesus we see. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-199, AH-144, SDAH-341)
Title: To God Be The Glory

Lyrics: Holy, holy, holy! Lord God Almighty!<BON:nextLine/>Early in the morning our song shall rise to Thee;<BON:nextLine/>Holy, holy, holy! Merciful and mighty!<BON:nextLine/>God over all who rules eternity. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Holy, holy, holy! Angels adore Thee,<BON:nextLine/>Casting down their bright crowns around the glassy sea;<BON:nextLine/>Thousands and ten thousands worship low before Thee,<BON:nextLine/>Which wert and art and evermore shalt be <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Holy, holy, holy! Though darkness hide Thee,<BON:nextLine/>Though the eye of man Thy great glory may not see<BON:nextLine/>Only Thou art holy; there is none beside Thee,<BON:nextLine/>Perfect in power, in love and purity. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-200, AH-30, SDAH-73)
Title: Holy, Holy, Holy

Lyrics: My heart was distressed ‘neath Jehovah's dread frown,<BON:nextLine/>And in the pit where my sins dragg'd me down;<BON:nextLine/>I cried to the Lord from the deep miry clay,<BON:nextLine/>Who tenderly brought me out to golden day. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>He brought me out of the miry clay,<BON:nextLine/>He set my feet on the Rock to stay;<BON:nextLine/>He puts a song in my soul today,<BON:nextLine/>A song of praise, hallelujah <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>He placed me upon the strong Rock by His side,<BON:nextLine/>My steps were established and here I'll abide;<BON:nextLine/>No danger of falling while here I remain,<BON:nextLine/>But stand by His grace until the crown I gain. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>He gave me a song, ‘twas a new song of praise,<BON:nextLine/>By day and by night its sweet notes I will raise;<BON:nextLine/>My heart's overflowing, I'm happy and free, <BON:nextLine/>I'll praise my Redeemer, who has rescued me. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>I'll sing of His wonderful mercy to me, <BON:nextLine/>I'll praise Him till all men His goodness shall see;<BON:nextLine/>I'll sing of salvation at home and abroad, <BON:nextLine/>Till many shall hear the truth and trust in God. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-201, AH-//, SDAH-//)
Title: He Brought Me Out

Lyrics: Jesus, Saviour, pilot me, <BON:nextLine/>Over life's tempestuous sea;<BON:nextLine/>Unknown waves before me roll,<BON:nextLine/>Hiding rock and treacherous shoal;<BON:nextLine/>Chart and compass come from Thee;<BON:nextLine/>Jesus Saviour pilot me. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>As a mother stills her child, <BON:nextLine/>Thou canst hush the ocean wild;<BON:nextLine/>Boisterous waves obey Thy will,<BON:nextLine/>When Thou sayest to them "Be still."<BON:nextLine/>Wondrous Sovereign of the sea,<BON:nextLine/>Jesus Saviour pilot me <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>When at last I near the shore,<BON:nextLine/>And the fearful breakers roar;<BON:nextLine/>‘Twixt me and the peaceful rest,<BON:nextLine/>Then, while leaning on Thy breast,<BON:nextLine/>May I hear Thee say to me,<BON:nextLine/>"Fear not I will pilot thee." <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-202, AH-297, SDAH-551)
Title: Jesus, Savour, Pilot Me

Lyrics: O, spread the tidings round,<BON:nextLine/>Where ever man is found,<BON:nextLine/>Where ever human hearts,<BON:nextLine/>And human woes abound;<BON:nextLine/>Let every Christian tongue,<BON:nextLine/>Proclaim the joyful sound;<BON:nextLine/>The Comforter has come! <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>The Comforter has come, <BON:nextLine/>The Comforter has come!<BON:nextLine/>The Holy Ghost form heaven, <BON:nextLine/>The Father's promise giv'n;<BON:nextLine/>O spread the tidings round,<BON:nextLine/>Where ever man is found,<BON:nextLine/>The Comforter is come! <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>The long, long night is past,<BON:nextLine/>The morning breaks at last;<BON:nextLine/>And hushed the dreadful wail,<BON:nextLine/>And fury of the blast,<BON:nextLine/>As o'er the golden hills,<BON:nextLine/>The day advances fast;<BON:nextLine/>The Comforter has come! <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Behold, the King of kings,<BON:nextLine/>With healing in his wings,<BON:nextLine/>To every captive soul,<BON:nextLine/>A full deliverance brings;<BON:nextLine/>And through the vacant cells,<BON:nextLine/>The song of triumph rings;<BON:nextLine/>The Comforter has come! <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>O boundless Love divine!<BON:nextLine/>How shall this tongue of mine,<BON:nextLine/>To wond'ring mortals tell, <BON:nextLine/>The matchless grace divine, <BON:nextLine/>That I, a child of sin, <BON:nextLine/>Should in his image shine!<BON:nextLine/>The Comforter has come! <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Sing, till the echoes fly,<BON:nextLine/>Above the vaulted sky,<BON:nextLine/>And all the saints above,<BON:nextLine/>To all below reply,<BON:nextLine/>In strains of endless love,<BON:nextLine/>The song that ne'er will die;<BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-203, AH-154, SDAH-//)
Title: The Comforter Has Come

Lyrics: In the land of strangers,<BON:nextLine/>Whither thou art gone,<BON:nextLine/>Hear a far voice calling,<BON:nextLine/>"My son! My son!" <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>‘Welcome! Wand'rer, welcome! <BON:nextLine/>Welcome back to home!<BON:nextLine/>Thou hast wandered far away;<BON:nextLine/>Come home! Come home!' <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>"From the land of hunger, <BON:nextLine/>Fainting, famished, lone,<BON:nextLine/>Come to love and gladness,<BON:nextLine/>My son, my son! <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>"Leave the haunts of riot,<BON:nextLine/>Wasted, woe-be-gone, <BON:nextLine/>Sick at heart and weary, <BON:nextLine/>My son! My son! <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>"See the door still open!<BON:nextLine/>Thou art still my own;<BON:nextLine/>Eyes of love are on thee,<BON:nextLine/>My son! My son! <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>"Far off thou hast wandered;<BON:nextLine/>Wilt thou farther roam?<BON:nextLine/>Come and all is pardoned, <BON:nextLine/>My son! My son! <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>"See the well-spread table, <BON:nextLine/>Unforgotten one!<BON:nextLine/>Here is rest and plenty,<BON:nextLine/>My son! My son! <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>"Thou art friendless, homeless,<BON:nextLine/>Hopeless, and undone;<BON:nextLine/>Mine is love unchanging,<BON:nextLine/>My son! My son! <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-204, AH-//, SDAH-//)
Title: Welcome! Wonderer, Come!
