Away, then, away! <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Throw out the lifeline to danger-fraught men,<BON:nextLine/>Sinking in anguish where you've never been;<BON:nextLine/>Winds of temptation and billows of woe,<BON:nextLine/>Will soon hurl them out where the dark waters flow. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Soon will the season of rescuer be o'er,<BON:nextLine/>Soon will they drift to eternity's shore;<BON:nextLine/>Haste, then, my brother, no time for delay,<BON:nextLine/>But throw out the lifeline and save them today. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-272, AH-349, SDAH-//)
Title: Throw Out The Lifeline

Lyrics: Just lean upon the arms of Jesus,<BON:nextLine/>He'll help you along, help you along;<BON:nextLine/>If you will trust His love un-falling,<BON:nextLine/>He'll fill your heart with song. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>Lean on His arms, trusting in His love;<BON:nextLine/>(Lean upon His arms, trusting in His love}<BON:nextLine/>Lean on His arms, all His mercies prove<BON:nextLine/>(Lean upon His arms and all His mercies prove)<BON:nextLine/>Lean on His arms, looking home above,<BON:nextLine/>(Lean upon His arms, ever)<BON:nextLine/>Just lean on the Saviour's arms. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Just lean upon the arms of Jesus,<BON:nextLine/>He'll brighten the way, brighten the way;<BON:nextLine/>Just follow gladly where He leadeth,<BON:nextLine/>His gentle voice obey. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Just lean upon the arms of Jesus, <BON:nextLine/>O bring ev'ry care, bring ev'ry care!<BON:nextLine/>The burden that has seemed so heavy,<BON:nextLine/>Take to the Lord in prayer. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Just lean upon the arms of Jesus,<BON:nextLine/>Then leave all to Him, leave all to him;<BON:nextLine/>His heart is full of love and mercy,<BON:nextLine/>His eyes are never dim. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-273, AH-//, SDAH-//)
Title: Lean On The Arms

Lyrics: I have a Saviour, he's pleading in glory,<BON:nextLine/>A dear, loving Saviour, tho' earth-friends be few;<BON:nextLine/>And now he is watching in tenderness o'er me,<BON:nextLine/>And O that my Saviour were your Saviour too. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>For you, I am praying , For you I am praying,<BON:nextLine/>For you I am praying, I'm praying for you. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>I have a Father ; to me He has given,<BON:nextLine/>A hope for eternity, blessed and true;<BON:nextLine/>And soon He will call me to meet Him in heaven,<BON:nextLine/>But oh that He'd let me bring with me, too. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>I have a robe; ‘tis resplendent in whiteness,<BON:nextLine/>Awaiting in glory my wondering view;<BON:nextLine/>Oh, when I receive it, all shining in brightness,<BON:nextLine/>Dear friend, could I see you receiving one, too. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>To me has been given a peace like a river;<BON:nextLine/>A peace that the friends of this world never knew;<BON:nextLine/>And Christ is the Author, and Christ is the Giver,<BON:nextLine/>And O that his peace might be given to you. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>When Jesus has found you, tell others the story,<BON:nextLine/>That my loving Saviour is your Saviour too;<BON:nextLine/>Then that your Saviour will bring them to glory,<BON:nextLine/>And prayer will be answered, ‘twas answered for you <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-274, AH-174, SDAH-284)
Title: I Have A Saviour

Lyrics: "Eternity! Where?" It floats in the air;<BON:nextLine/>Amid calm or or silence it ever is there!<BON:nextLine/>The question s solemn, "Eternity! Where?"<BON:nextLine/>The question so solemn, "Eternity! Where?" <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>"Eternity! Where?" Oh! Eternity! Where?<BON:nextLine/>With redeemed ones in glory, or lost in despair?<BON:nextLine/>‘Tis one or the other, "Eternity! Where?"<BON:nextLine/>‘Tis one or the other, "Eternity! Where?" <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Eternity! Where?" Oh! How can you share,<BON:nextLine/>The world's giddy pleasures, or heedlessly dare.<BON:nextLine/>Do aught till you settle, "Eternity! Where?"<BON:nextLine/>Do aught till you settle, "Eternity! Where?" <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>"Eternity! Where?" Oh! Friend, have a care;<BON:nextLine/>Soon God will no longer His judgment forebear;<BON:nextLine/>This day may decide your "Eternity! Where?"<BON:nextLine/>This day may decide your "Eternity where?" <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>"Eternity! Where?" Oh! Eternity! Where?<BON:nextLine/>Friend, sleep not, nor take in the world any share,<BON:nextLine/>Till you answer this question, "Eternity! Where?"<BON:nextLine/>Till you answer this question, "Eternity! Where?" <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-275, AH-//, SDAH-//)
Title: Eternity! Where?

Lyrics: Jesus, my Saviour to Bethlehem came,<BON:nextLine/>Born in a manger to sorrow and shame;<BON:nextLine/>O, it was wonderful, blest be His name!<BON:nextLine/>Seeking for me, for me.<BON:nextLine/>Seeking for me, for me, seeking for me, for me,<BON:nextLine/>O, it was wonderful, blest be His name!<BON:nextLine/>Seeking for me, for me. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Jesus, my Saviour, on Calvary's tree,<BON:nextLine/>Paid the great debt and my soul He set free;<BON:nextLine/>O, it was wonderful, how could it be?<BON:nextLine/>Dying for me, for me.<BON:nextLine/>Dying for me, for me, dying for me, for me,<BON:nextLine/>O, it was wonderful, how could it be?<BON:nextLine/>Dying for me, for me. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Jesus, my Saviour, the same as of old,<BON:nextLine/>While I was wand'ring afar from the fold,<BON:nextLine/>Gently and long did He plead with my soul,<BON:nextLine/>Calling for me, for me,<BON:nextLine/>Calling for me, for me, calling for me, for me,<BON:nextLine/>Gently and long did He plead with my soul,<BON:nextLine/>Calling for me, for me. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Jesus my Saviour shall come from on high,<BON:nextLine/>Sweet is the promise as weary years fly,<BON:nextLine/>O, I shall see Him descending the sky,<BON:nextLine/>Coming for me, for me.<BON:nextLine/>Coming for me, for me, coming for me, for me,<BON:nextLine/>O, I shall see Him descending the sky,<BON:nextLine/>Coming for me, for me. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-276, AH-//, SDAH-//)
Title: Seeking For Me

Lyrics: Lead, kindly Light, amid the encircling gloom,<BON:nextLine/>Lead Thou me on;<BON:nextLine/>The night is dark, and I am far from home;<BON:nextLine/>Lead Thou me on.<BON:nextLine/>Keep Thou my feet; I do not ask to see,<BON:nextLine/>The distant scene; one step's enough for me. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>I was not ever thus, nor prayed that<BON:nextLine/>Thou Shouldst lead me on;<BON:nextLine/>I loved to choose and see my path; but now,<BON:nextLine/>Lead Thou me on.<BON:nextLine/>I loved the garish day, and, spite of fears,<BON:nextLine/>Pride ruled my will, Remember not passed years. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>So long Thy power hath blest me, sure it still,<BON:nextLine/>Will lead me on;<BON:nextLine/>O'er moor and fen, o'er crag and torrent, till,<BON:nextLine/>The night is gone;<BON:nextLine/>And with the morn those angel faces smile,<BON:nextLine/>Which I have loved long since, and lost awhile. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-277, AH-306, SDAH-//)
Title: Lead Kindly Light

Lyrics: Thy way, not mine, O lord, However dark it be;<BON:nextLine/>Lead me by thine own hand, And chose the path for me.<BON:nextLine/>I dare not choose my lot; I would not if I might;<BON:nextLine/>Choose thou for me, my God, So shall I walk a-right. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>The kingdom that I seek, Is thine; so let the way,<BON:nextLine/>That leads to it be thine, Else I must surely stray,<BON:nextLine/>Hold thou my cup of life; With joy or sorrow fill,<BON:nextLine/>As best to thee may seem; Choose thou my good and ill <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Choose thou for me my friends, My sickness or my health;<BON:nextLine/>Choose thou my cares for me, My poverty or wealth,<BON:nextLine/>Not mine, not mine the choice, In either great or small,<BON:nextLine/>Be thou my Guide, my Strength, My Wisdom, and my All. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-278, AH-//, SDAH-//)
Title: Not My Way

Lyrics: O heart bowed down with sorrow!<BON:nextLine/>O eyes that long for sight!<BON:nextLine/>There's gladness in the believing;<BON:nextLine/>In Jesus there is light. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>"Come unto me,… all ye ... that labor,<BON:nextLine/>(Come, O come, come unto me,)<BON:nextLine/>(Come, O come, all ye that labor;)<BON:nextLine/>and ... are heavy laden, and I...will give you rest..<BON:nextLine/>(Come, O come, heavy laden souls,)<BON:nextLine/>( I ... will give you rest)<BON:nextLine/>Take … my yoke upon you, and learn ...of me...<BON:nextLine/>(Come, O, come, come, take my yoke,)<BON:nextLine/>(Come, O come, come learn of me;)<BON:nextLine/>for I . Am meek and lowly in heart;<BON:nextLine/>And ye shall find rest unto your souls.<BON:nextLine/>(I am meek and lowly in heart;) <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Earth's fleeting gain and pleasure,<BON:nextLine/>Can never satisfy;<BON:nextLine/>‘Tis love our joy doth measure,<BON:nextLine/>For love can never die. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Divinest consolation,<BON:nextLine/>Doth Christ the Healer give;<BON:nextLine/>Art thou in condemnation?<BON:nextLine/>Repent, believe, and live. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>His peace is like a river,<BON:nextLine/>His love is like a song;<BON:nextLine/>His yoke's a burden never;<BON:nextLine/>‘Tis easy all the way. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-279, AH-//, SDAH-//)
Title: "Come Unto Me"

Lyrics: Our sweetest songs of gladness,<BON:nextLine/>On this delightful day,<BON:nextLine/>We bring to praise the Saviour,<BON:nextLine/>Who is the Life, the Way. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>We sing...we sing, The praises of our King,<BON:nextLine/>(We sing)... (We sing) (Heav'nly King)<BON:nextLine/>We sing... we sing The glory of our King.<BON:nextLine/>(We sing)...(We sing) <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>He loved the little children,<BON:nextLine/>When he was here below;<BON:nextLine/>And thou he's up in heaven,<BON:nextLine/>He loves us yet we know. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>We love to sing his praises,<BON:nextLine/>And hear the stories told,<BON:nextLine/>Of Him when he was dwelling,<BON:nextLine/>In Galilee of old. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>He loved the little children,<BON:nextLine/>When he was here below;<BON:nextLine/>And thou he's up in heaven,<BON:nextLine/>He loves us yet we know. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>O Savour, blessed Saviour,<BON:nextLine/>We kneel before thy throne,<BON:nextLine/>And ask that thou wilt help us,<BON:nextLine/>To live for thee alone. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-280, AH-//, SDAH-//)
Title: Our King

Lyrics: A beautiful star arose one night,<BON:nextLine/>Divinely it shone with purest light;<BON:nextLine/>Its wonderful rays the wise men led,<BON:nextLine/>To find the Saviour's lowly bed. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt> <BON:nextLine/>‘Tis shining still, ‘tis shining still,<BON:nextLine/>That beautiful star, o'er plain and hill;<BON:nextLine/>‘Tis shining still, ‘tis shining still, <BON:nextLine/>Salvation's star of God's good will. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>They knew by the word of truth divine,<BON:nextLine/>‘Twas time that the guiding star should shine; <BON:nextLine/>They followed its light which shone afar, <BON:nextLine/>‘Twas Christ, "the bright and morning star." <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>We'll follow its light, like those of old,<BON:nextLine/>The "Light of the World," by seers foretold;<BON:nextLine/>We'll follow his light till we shall come,<BON:nextLine/>To perfect rest in heaven, my home. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-281, AH-//, SDAH-//)
Title: A Beautiful Star

Lyrics: Hark! Ten thousand harps and voices,<BON:nextLine/>Sound the note of praise above;<BON:nextLine/>Jesus reigns, and heav'n rejoices,<BON:nextLine/>Jesus reigns, the God of love; <BON:nextLine/>See, he its on yonder throne;<BON:nextLine/>Jesus rules the world alone,<BON:nextLine/>Hallelujah! Hallelujah! Hallelujah! Amen. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>King of glory, reign forever,<BON:nextLine/>Thine an everlasting crown;<BON:nextLine/>Nothing from thy love shall ever,<BON:nextLine/>Those whom dost seal thine own;<BON:nextLine/>Happy objects of thy grace, <BON:nextLine/>Destined to behold thy face, <BON:nextLine/>Hallelujah! Hallelujah! Hallelujah! Amen. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Saviour, hasten thine appearing;<BON:nextLine/>Bring, O bring, the glorious day;<BON:nextLine/>When the awful summons hearing,<BON:nextLine/>Heav'n and earth shall pass away!<BON:nextLine/>Then with golden harps, we'll sing,<BON:nextLine/>"Glory, glory to our King."<BON:nextLine/>Hallelujah! Hallelujah! Hallelujah! Amen. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-282, AH-//, SDAH-//)
Title: Ten Thousand Harps

Lyrics: Some one will enter the pearly gate;<BON:nextLine/>By and by, by and by,<BON:nextLine/>Taste of the glories that there await,<BON:nextLine/>Shall you? Shall I? Shall you? Shall I? <BON:nextLine/>Some-one will the streets of gold,<BON:nextLine/>Beautiful visions will there behold,<BON:nextLine/>Feast on the pleasures so long foretold <BON:nextLine/>Shall you? Shall I? Shall you? Shall I? <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Some one will gladly his cross lay down; <BON:nextLine/>By and by, by and by, <BON:nextLine/>Faithful, approved, shall receive a crown,<BON:nextLine/>Shall you? Shall I? Shall you? Shall I? <BON:nextLine/>Some one the glorious King will see,<BON:nextLine/>Ever from sorrow of earth be free,<BON:nextLine/>Happy with Him through eternity; <BON:nextLine/>Shall you? Shall I? Shall you? Shall I? <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Some one will knock when the door is shut,<BON:nextLine/>By and by, by and by,<BON:nextLine/>Hear a voice saying, "I know you not;" <BON:nextLine/>Shall you? Shall I? Shall you? Shall I? <BON:nextLine/>Some one will call and shall not be heard,<BON:nextLine/>Vainly will strive when the door is barred,<BON:nextLine/>Some one will fail of the saints' reward;<BON:nextLine/>Shall you? Shall I? Shall you? Shall I? <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Some one will sing the triumphant song,<BON:nextLine/>By and by, by and by,<BON:nextLine/>Join in the praise with the b
Subtitle: (Vern-283, AH-176, SDAH-//)
Title: Shall You Shall I?

Lyrics: There are lonely hearts to cherish,<BON:nextLine/>While the days are going by;<BON:nextLine/>There are weary souls who perish,<BON:nextLine/>While the days are going by;<BON:nextLine/>If a smile we can renew,<BON:nextLine/>As our journey we pursue,<BON:nextLine/>O, the good we all may do,<BON:nextLine/>While the days are going by. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>Going by, going by, Going by, going by, <BON:nextLine/>(Going by) (going by) (going by) (going by) <BON:nextLine/>O, the good we all may do,<BON:nextLine/>While the days are going by! <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>There is no time for idle scorning,<BON:nextLine/>While the days are going by; <BON:nextLine/>Let your face be like the morning,<BON:nextLine/>While the days are going by;<BON:nextLine/>For the world is full of sighs, <BON:nextLine/>Full of sad and weeping eyes; <BON:nextLine/>Help your fallen brother rise,<BON:nextLine/>While the days are going by. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>All the loving links that bind us,<BON:nextLine/>While the days are going by;<BON:nextLine/>One by one we leave behind us,<BON:nextLine/>While the days are going by,<BON:nextLine/>But the seeds of good we sow,<BON:nextLine/>Both in shade and shine will grow,<BON:nextLine/>And will keep our hearts aglow,<BON:nextLine/>While the days are going by. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-284, AH-284, SDAH-554)
Title: While The Days Are Going By

Lyrics: There is a place of quiet rest,<BON:nextLine/>Near to the heart of God;<BON:nextLine/>A place where sin can not molest,<BON:nextLine/>Near to the heart of God. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>O Jesus, blest Redeemer, <BON:nextLine/>Sent from the heart of God,<BON:nextLine/>Hold us, who wait before Thee,<BON:nextLine/>Near to the heart of God. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>There is a place of comfort sweet,<BON:nextLine/>Near to the heart of God;<BON:nextLine/>A place where we our Saviour meet,<BON:nextLine/>Near to the heart of God. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>There is a place of full release,<BON:nextLine/>Near to the heart of God;<BON:nextLine/>A place where all is joy and peace,<BON:nextLine/>Near to the heart of God. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-285, AH-252, SDAH-495)
Title: There Is A Place Of Quiet Rest

Lyrics: O how I long to see that day,<BON:nextLine/>When the redeemed shall come<BON:nextLine/>To Zion, clad in white array,<BON:nextLine/>Their blissful, happy home. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>O bear me on, bear me on, To Mount Zion,<BON:nextLine/>O bear me on to that city of love,<BON:nextLine/>Where saints shall ever dwell. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>I'll hear the alleluias roll, <BON:nextLine/>From the unnumbered throng,<BON:nextLine/>And with a heaven-enraptured soul,<BON:nextLine/>I'll join redemption's song. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>All hail! The morn of glory's nigh,<BON:nextLine/>The pilgrim longs to see;<BON:nextLine/>That dries the tear from every eye,<BON:nextLine/>Creation's jubilee. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-286, AH-//, SDAH-//)
Title: Bear Me On

Lyrics: In the hour of trial, Jesus, plead for me,<BON:nextLine/>Lest by base denial I depart from Thee;<BON:nextLine/>When Thou see'st me waver, With a look recall,<BON:nextLine/>Nor, for fear or favor, Suffer me to fall. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>With forbidden pleasures,<BON:nextLine/>Would this vain world charm;<BON:nextLine/>Or its sordid treasures,<BON:nextLine/>Spread to work me harm; <BON:nextLine/>Bring to my remembrance,<BON:nextLine/>Sad Gethsemane, <BON:nextLine/>Or, in darker semblance,<BON:nextLine/>Cross-crowned Calvary. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Should Thy mercy send me,<BON:nextLine/>Sorrow, toil, and woe, <BON:nextLine/>Or should pain attend me,<BON:nextLine/>On my path below, <BON:nextLine/>Grant that I may never,<BON:nextLine/>Fail Thy hand to see; <BON:nextLine/>Grant that I may ever,<BON:nextLine/>Cast my care on Thee. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-287, AH-277, SDAH-491)
Title: In The Hour Of Trial

Lyrics: They brought their gifts to Jesus,<BON:nextLine/>And laid them at His feet,<BON:nextLine/>And love for this dear Saviour,<BON:nextLine/>Made every offering sweet;<BON:nextLine/>Good deeds and words of kindness,<BON:nextLine/>Help for the poor of earth, <BON:nextLine/>And not a gift among them,<BON:nextLine/>Was thought of little worth. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>Wouldst bring a gift to Jesus,<BON:nextLine/>That He will count most sweet? <BON:nextLine/>Say "Lord, my heart I give Thee,"<BON:nextLine/>And lay it at His feet. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Apart from other givers,<BON:nextLine/>A poor way-farer stood;<BON:nextLine/>He saw the gifts they offered,<BON:nextLine/>The poorest counted good,<BON:nextLine/>And he was filled with longing,<BON:nextLine/>A gift, though poor to bring; <BON:nextLine/>Alas! All empty- handed,<BON:nextLine/>He stood before the King. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>"Dear Lord," he cried in sorrow,<BON:nextLine/>"I know kind Thou art,<BON:nextLine/>Take all I have to give Thee,<BON:nextLine/>My sinful way-ward heart;"<BON:nextLine/>Then Jesus answered softly,<BON:nextLine/>"Count not the gift as small,<BON:nextLine/>Though all of them are precious,<BON:nextLine/>Thine is the best of all." <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-288, AH-346, SDAH-//)
Title: They Brought Their Gifts To Jesus

Lyrics: Jesus, my Lord, to thee I cry;<BON:nextLine/>Unless thou help me I must die;<BON:nextLine/>Oh, bring thy free salvation nigh,<BON:nextLine/>And take me as I am. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>Take me as I am, Take me as I am,<BON:nextLine/>Oh, bring thy free salvation nigh,<BON:nextLine/>And take me as I am. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Helpless I am, and full of guilt,<BON:nextLine/>But yet thy blood for me was spilt; <BON:nextLine/>And thou canst make what thou wilt,<BON:nextLine/>But take me as I am. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>No preparation can I make,<BON:nextLine/>My best resolves I only break;<BON:nextLine/>Yet save me for thine own name's sake,<BON:nextLine/>And take me as I am. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>I bow before thy mercy seat,<BON:nextLine/>Behold me, Saviour, at thy feet;<BON:nextLine/>Thy work begin, thy work complete,<BON:nextLine/>And take me as I am. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>If thou hast work for me to do,<BON:nextLine/>Inspire my will, my heart renew; <BON:nextLine/>And work both in, and by me, too, <BON:nextLine/>And take me as I am. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>And when at last the work is done,<BON:nextLine/>The battle fought, the vict'ry won;<BON:nextLine/>Still, still my cry shall be alone,<BON:nextLine/>Lord, take me as I am. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-289, AH-//, SDAH-//)
Title: Take Me As I Am

Lyrics: Gladly, gladly, toiling for the Master,<BON:nextLine/>Go we forth with willing hands to do;<BON:nextLine/>Whatso'er to us he hath appointed,<BON:nextLine/>Faithfully our mission we'll pursue. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>Toil…………ing for Jesus,<BON:nextLine/>(Toiling, toiling for the Master) (yes)<BON:nextLine/>Joyfully we go, joyfully we go;<BON:nextLine/>Toil…………ing for Jesus, <BON:nextLine/>(Toiling, toiling for the Master)<BON:nextLine/>In his vineyard here below. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Joyful, joyful, we will tell the story,<BON:nextLine/>Of his love to mortals here below; <BON:nextLine/>Christ, the brightness of the Father's glory,<BON:nextLine/>Freely here his blessing will bestow. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Meekly, meekly, following the Master,<BON:nextLine/>Walking faithfully the path he trod;<BON:nextLine/>Leading wand'rers to the dear Redeemer,<BON:nextLine/>Pointing sinners to the Lamb of God. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-290, AH-//, SDAH-//)
Title: Toiling For Jesus

Lyrics: Worthy, worthy, is the Lamb,<BON:nextLine/>Worthy, worthy, is the Lamb;<BON:nextLine/>Worthy, worthy, is the Lamb, That was slain. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>Glory, hallelujah!<BON:nextLine/>Praise Him, hallelujah!<BON:nextLine/>Glory, hallelujah! To the Lamb! <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Saviour, let Thy kingdom come!<BON:nextLine/>Now the power of sin consume; <BON:nextLine/>Bring Thy blest millennium, <BON:nextLine/>Holy Lamb. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Thus may we each moment feel,<BON:nextLine/>Love Him, serve Him, praise Him still;<BON:nextLine/>Till we all on Zion's hill, See the Lamb. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-291, AH-145, SDAH-246)
Title: Worthy, Worthy, Is The Lamb

Lyrics: I've two little hands to work for Jesus<BON:nextLine/>One little tongue his praise to tell,<BON:nextLine/>Two little ears to hear his counsel,<BON:nextLine/>One little voice a song to swell. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>Lord, we come, Lord, we come,<BON:nextLine/>In our childhood's early morning,<BON:nextLine/>Lord, we come, Lord, we come, <BON:nextLine/>Come to learn of thee. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>I've two little feet to tread the pathway,<BON:nextLine/>Up to the heavenly courts above;<BON:nextLine/>Two little eyes to read the Bible, <BON:nextLine/>Telling of Jesus' wondrous love. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>I've one little heart to give to Jesus,<BON:nextLine/>One little soul for him to save;<BON:nextLine/>One little life for His dear service,<BON:nextLine/>One little self that he must have. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-292, AH-462, SDAH-//)
Title: Two Little Hands

Lyrics: Knocking, knocking, who is there? <BON:nextLine/>Waiting, waiting, O how fair! <BON:nextLine/>‘Tis a Pilgrim, strange and kindly,<BON:nextLine/>Never such was seen before;<BON:nextLine/>Ah! My soul, for such a wonder,<BON:nextLine/>Wilt thou not undo the door? <BON:nextLine/>Wilt thou undo the door? <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Knocking, knocking, still He's there,<BON:nextLine/>Waiting, waiting, wondrous fair;<BON:nextLine/>But the door is hard to open,<BON:nextLine/>For the weeds and ivy vine,<BON:nextLine/>With their dark and clinging tendrils,<BON:nextLine/>Ever round the hinges twine,<BON:nextLine/>Ever round the hinges twine. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Knocking, knocking, what! Still there?<BON:nextLine/>Waiting, waiting, grand and fair; <BON:nextLine/>Yes, the wounded hand still knocketh, <BON:nextLine/>And beneath the thorn-wreath'd hair, <BON:nextLine/>Beam the patient eyes, so tender, <BON:nextLine/>Of thy Saviour waiting there; <BON:nextLine/>Wilt thou keep him waiting there? <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-293, AH-//, SDAH-//)
Title: Knocking, Knocking

Lyrics: Look upon Jesus, sinless is He;<BON:nextLine/>Father, impute His life unto me,<BON:nextLine/>My life of scarlet, my sin and woe,<BON:nextLine/>Cover with His life, whiter than snow. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>Cover with His life, whiter than snow,<BON:nextLine/>Fullness of His life then shall I know; <BON:nextLine/>My life of scarlet, my sin and woe,<BON:nextLine/>Cover with His life, whiter than snow. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Deep are the wounds transgression has made;<BON:nextLine/>Red are the stains, my soul is afraid,<BON:nextLine/>O to be covered, Jesus, with Thee,<BON:nextLine/>Safe from the law that now judgeth me! <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Longing the joy of pardon to know,<BON:nextLine/>Jesus holds out a robe white as snow;<BON:nextLine/>"Lord, I accept it! Leaving my own,<BON:nextLine/>Gladly I wear Thy pure life alone." <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Reconciled by His death for my sin, <BON:nextLine/>Justified by His life pure and clean, <BON:nextLine/>Sanctified by obeying His word,<BON:nextLine/>Glorified when returneth my soul. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-294, AH-198, SDAH-412)
Title: Cover With His Life

Lyrics: Sound the battle cry, See! The foe is nigh;<BON:nextLine/>Raise the standard high for the Lord;<BON:nextLine/>Gird your armor on, Stand firm every one, Rest your cause upon His holy word. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt> <BON:nextLine/>Rouse, then, soldiers! Rally round the banner!<BON:nextLine/>Ready, steady, pass the word along;<BON:nextLine/>Onward, forward, shout aloud Hosanna!<BON:nextLine/>Christ is Captain of the mighty throng. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Strong to meet the foe, Marching on we go,<BON:nextLine/>While our cause we know must prevail;<BON:nextLine/>Shield and banner bright, Gleaming in the light,<BON:nextLine/>Battling for the right, we ne'er can fail. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>O Thou God of all Hear us while we call,<BON:nextLine/>Help us one and all, by Thy grace;<BON:nextLine/>When the battle's done, And the victory won, <BON:nextLine/>May we wear the crown before Thy face. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-295, AH-469, SDAH-614)
Title: Sound The Battle Cry

Lyrics: Saviour, lead me lest I stray, <BON:nextLine/>Gently lead me all the way;<BON:nextLine/>I am safe when by thy side,<BON:nextLine/>I would in thy love abide. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>Lead me, lead me, Saviour, lead me, lest I stray; <BON:nextLine/>Gently down the stream of time,<BON:nextLine/>Lead me Saviour, all the way. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Thou the refuge of my soul,<BON:nextLine/>When life's stormy billows roll; <BON:nextLine/>I am safe when thou art nigh,<BON:nextLine/>All my hopes on thee rely. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Saviour, lead me till at last,<BON:nextLine/>When the storm of life is past;<BON:nextLine/>I shall reach the land of day,<BON:nextLine/>Where all tears are wiped away. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-296, AH-//, SDAH-//)
Title: Lead Me, Saviour

Lyrics: There was one who was willing to die in my stead,<BON:nextLine/>That a soul so unworthy might live,<BON:nextLine/>And the path to the cross, He was willing to tread,<BON:nextLine/>All the sins of my life to forgive. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>They are nailed to the cross,<BON:nextLine/>They are nailed to the cross,<BON:nextLine/>O how mush He was willing to bear! <BON:nextLine/>With what anguish and loss, <BON:nextLine/>Jesus went to the cross! <BON:nextLine/>But He carried my sins with Him there. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>He is tender and loving and patient with me,<BON:nextLine/>While He cleanses my heart of its dross, <BON:nextLine/>But "there's no condemnation;" I know I am free,<BON:nextLine/>For my sins are all nailed to the cross. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>I will cling to my Saviour and never depart,<BON:nextLine/>I will joyfully journey each day,<BON:nextLine/>With a song on my lips and a song in my heart,<BON:nextLine/>That my sins have been taken away. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-297, AH-88, SDAH-//)
Title: Nailed To The Cross

Lyrics: O, the bitter pain and sorrow,<BON:nextLine/>That a time could ever be,<BON:nextLine/>When I proudly said to Jesus, <BON:nextLine/>"All of self and none of Thee."<BON:nextLine/>All of self and none of Thee, <BON:nextLine/>All of self and none of Thee, <BON:nextLine/>When I proudly say to Jesus,<BON:nextLine/>"All of self and none of Thee!" <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Yet He found me; I beheld Him, <BON:nextLine/>Bleeding on the accursed tree,<BON:nextLine/>And my wistful heart said faintly,<BON:nextLine/>"Some of self and some of Thee."<BON:nextLine/>Some of self and some of Thee,<BON:nextLine/>Some of self and some of Thee, <BON:nextLine/>And my wistful heart said faintly,<BON:nextLine/>"Some of self and some of Thee!" <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Day by day His tender mercy,<BON:nextLine/>Healing, helping, full and free, <BON:nextLine/>Brought me lower, while I whispered, <BON:nextLine/>"Less of self and more of Thee,"<BON:nextLine/>Less of self and more of Thee,<BON:nextLine/>Less of self and more of Thee,<BON:nextLine/>Brought me lower, while I whispered,<BON:nextLine/>"Less of self and more of Thee!" <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Higher than the highest heavens,<BON:nextLine/>Deeper than the deepest sea,<BON:nextLine/>Lord, Thy love at last has conquered,<BON:nextLine/>"None of self and all of Thee."<BON:nextLine/>None of self and all for Thee, <BON:nextLine/>None of self and all of Thee, <BON:nextLine/>Lord, Thy love at last has conquered,<BON:nextLine/>"None of self and all of Thee!" <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-298, AH-//, SDAH-//)
Title: "None Of Self And All Of Thee"

Lyrics: Let our hearts be always cheerful;<BON:nextLine/>Why should murmuring enter there,<BON:nextLine/>When our kind and loving Father,<BON:nextLine/>Makes us children of His care.<BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>Always cheerful, always cheerful,<BON:nextLine/>Sunshine all around we see; <BON:nextLine/>Full of beauty is the path of duty,<BON:nextLine/>Cheerful we may always be. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>With His gentle hand to lead us,<BON:nextLine/>Should the pow'rs of sin assail,<BON:nextLine/>He has promised grace to help us; <BON:nextLine/>Never can His promise fail. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>When we turn aside from duty,<BON:nextLine/>Comes the pain of doing wrong;<BON:nextLine/>And a shadow, creeping o'er us,<BON:nextLine/>Checks the rapture of our song. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Oh! The good are always happy, <BON:nextLine/>And their path is ever bright;<BON:nextLine/>Let us heed the blessed counsel,<BON:nextLine/>Shun the wrong and love the right. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-299, AH-//, SDAH-//)
Title: Always Cheerful

Lyrics: In the Christian's home in glory,<BON:nextLine/>There remains a land of rest<BON:nextLine/>And my Saviour's gone before me,<BON:nextLine/>To fulfill my soul's request. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/><tt>CHORUS</tt><BON:nextLine/>There is rest for the weary, <BON:nextLine/>There is rest for the weary,<BON:nextLine/>There is rest for the weary,<BON:nextLine/>There is rest for you. <BON:nextLine/>On the other side of Jordan,<BON:nextLine/>In the sweet fields of Eden,<BON:nextLine/>Where the tree of life is blooming, <BON:nextLine/>There is rest for you. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>He is fitting up my mansion,<BON:nextLine/>Which eternally shall stand,<BON:nextLine/>For my stay shall be transient,<BON:nextLine/>In that holy, happy land. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Pain or sickness ne'er shall enter,<BON:nextLine/>Grief nor woe my lot shall share;<BON:nextLine/>But in that celestial center,<BON:nextLine/>I a crown of life shall wear. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Death itself shall then be vanquished,<BON:nextLine/>And its stung shall be withdrawn; <BON:nextLine/>Shout for gladness, O ye ransomed! <BON:nextLine/>Hail with joy the rising morn. <BON:nextLine/><BON:nextLine/>Sing, O sing, ye heirs of glory,<BON:nextLine/>Shout your triumph as you go; <BON:nextLine/>Zion's gates will open for you, <BON:nextLine/>You shall find an entrance through. <BON:nextLine/>
Subtitle: (Vern-300, AH-//, SDAH-//)
Title: Rest For The Weary
